text: 16 oz can into a sniffer. Hazy gold beer with orange hues, and a white head. Aromas of tropical fruit and fresh wheat. Tastes of mango, fresh oranges, grapefruit, and floral hops. Decent malt backbone. Hoppy finish with some mango. Tropical, juicy, and very refreshing. Nice surprise.

Solid pale ale, but definitely overrated. Dont get me wrong, I enjoyed this pale ale a ton. The mouthfeel is ridiculous for being a pale ale. Feels much more like an IPA. It has a tropical taste going on which is great as well. Im a big fan of this beer, but I still think its a bit overrated.

Hazed golden with a sudsy white head. Piney citrus aroma. Light bodied, balanced piney citrus hop with a mild malt flavor. 

Notes: can in Deadwood SD, June 17

Can 16oz: Hazy, deep straw with a hint of copper, great head and lace. Mich of hop and malt. Lovely tropical aroma. Hint of pine. Fruit yeast or malt profile. The palate is dry. balanced and fresh. Some sweetness but not the weight of an IPA or DIPA. Bitterness is balanced almost perfectly. A wonderful beer. 

Why drink a session IPA when you have beers like this.
The igifududufivifudydskgbifufifufufupfofodyoxyodoydoy via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can in Seattle. Creamy head, sticks around well. Touch hazier than clear, orange. Well balanced Citra aroma, with plenty of malt backing. Quite modest bitterness. Easy drinker, good orange citrus flavors, low resin note. Not impressive at first glance, but it has a great finesse. A slight mintiness to the hoppy finish. Modest bitterness at the end.

Can 16 oz., thanks to Slacker. Pours a bit hazy orange with medium white head, nice reception. Fruits, melon, apricot, mango, malts, citrus, a bit grass, grapefruit in the aftertaste. Medium body and soft to average carbonation.

Appearance: Bright light copper. Slightly hazy. Finger of white foam. Good Lace.
Nose: Lightly roasted malt sweetness with a decent kick of citrus hops and a bit of dank. 
Taste: Dank and citrus. Subtle sweetness. Decent bitters through the finish. 
Body: medium to lighter. Active carbonation.
Parting thoughts: An IPA in a tall boy with a dinosaur on it? fantastic. it doesnt hurt that its a very solid quaff either.

Out of a can. Pours slightly cloudy golden with some white head. Scent is citrus, most similar to grapefruit, flowers, and hops. Taste is similar: citrus with a hint of sweeter, darker fruit, as well as a light hoppy bitterness. Body is quite light. Finish is refreshingly crisp without as much aftertaste as some hoppier IPAs. One of the best pale ales I've had.

Draught at MBCC blue session. Hazy amber-gold body, spotty lacing, low pearl white head. Smell of ripe citrus. Sappy orange fruity flavours followed by citrus peels. Soft on the swallow. Pleasing.(Copenhagen 12.05.2017).
Pours a golden amber from a can. Aroma is mostly pale malt, a little caramel and some lemony hop characteristic, flavor is similar, well-balanced but nothing outstanding. Good beer.

Can from Marcus. Pours translucent gold with a white head. Aroma seems dankly citrus. Med + body. Strongish carbonation. Flavor is citrus and pine/green. Dank for me. Supporting slightly roasty malt. Surprised I can find the malt - lots and lots of hop. Not exactly harshly bitter, but close enough. In the bitter finish it seems to become somewhat juicy. Great stuff.

First tick from this hype train brewery. Pint can at the Crafty Fox. Clear golden copper color at first, which becomes cloudy with floaties towards the bottom. One finger of white head. Aroma is nice, mango, grapefruit, pine, honey. Flavor has a touch of sweet honey malt yielding to pretty big citrus, tropical, pine hops. Clean and crisp feel, medium body, slightly sticky. Really good pale ale. SOME of the hype is warranted.

This single hop pale ale showcases the Citra hop for a well balanced beer that is delicate in body with a mild bitterness in the finish. She roars with ferocious aromas of grapefruit, citrus, mango and evergreen. pseudoSue’s unique and addictive taste is clean and bright with just enough bite! Admin Note: Previously brewed as a 5.8% ABV offering, current and future batches are listed at 7% ABV per a tweak and translating the beer to a larger 30 bbl system. Tweaks may continue to change this ABV slightly as they settle on an official end product.
Very good pale ale

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lots of citrus in nose including lemon, orange, grapefruit, lime. Pours golden with white lacy head. Taste is medium dry with citrus and fine malty backbone as well as some tropical fruits. Low bitter finish, average to lively carbo. Overall very good, drinkable and refreshing.

Hazy amber colored with a white head that lasts. Aroma of mango, grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruit, light caramel. Medium bodied, moderate to high bitterness, big fruity flavors. How this is a pale ale is beyond me, but Id love to try this next to Alpha King.

The ratings for this beer are rather remarkable, and Im sure in a fresh pour from tap theres something wonderful about tasting such a beer--sometimes high ratings garner future high ratings. I had a canned version, and it was an excellent beer, but certainly nothing game-changing or especially memorable. Juicy, fruity aroma, good balance and highly drinkable. Citra has been the best thing for IPAs, ever, and this beer does right by them. Highly drinkable. Can purchased in Iowa.

Canned two and a half weeks ago. The can has a cool T-Rex with gaping jaws! Pours a merigold shade of orange with a half finger of head, no carbonation through the hazy pour, I get evergreen on the nose. The palate is a slightly bitter biscuit, earthy, I cant put my finger on it...what this tastes like. Its not sweet. Meaty, perhaps? Let me crack my second one. Ah. This one sounds good. Yes, sounds healthy. Letting this one sit a while in the glass to warm up a bit. Picking up sweet, sticky pine on the nose & dried mango. Crisp, yet I am missing some main character in taste.

Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and citrus.
Fruity flavour of hops, pine needles and citrus.
Hoppy finish.

Canned 5/1/17. Poured with a large white head, lots of particulates. Big notes of citrus & melon on the aroma & palate. Very easy to drink, light round mouthfeel that just adds to how juicy & fruity this beer is. Light bitterness on the finish. Its a great beer.
On tap at MBCC. Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Juicy citrus aroma with malty notes. Sweetish fruity flavour with pineapple, melon and kiwi. Light bitter finish.
MBCC. Hazy yellow with light white head. Citrus with pine, grass. Good but nothing stunning.
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is hoppy, floral, fruity. Taste is hoppy, not too bitter, very nice balance.

Data puszkowania:  24.02.2017 
 Kolor:  Jasnobursztynowy. Piwo jest w 100%-ach klarowne. 
 Piana:  Jest wysoka, bujna, w umiarkowanym tempie opada do chmurki. Nie wylewa się z szkła przy agresywnym nalewaniu.
Biała, drobnoziarnista warstewka puchu przez długi czas wisi nad piwem.
Lacing godny mistrzów. 
 Zapach:  Fantastyczny aromat owoców tropikalnych. Zaraz po odkapslowaniu puszki mam ochotę pochłonąć ją w całości i ominąć etap przelewania do szkła.
Pachnie mango, marakują, 
a na przeciwko tych owoców stają w szranki cytrusy. Nie brakuje ananasów, grejpfrutów, czy mandarynek. Nuty żywicy, lasu i igiełek sosnowych uzupełniają profil zapachowy. 
 Smak:  Dopiero po 5, czy 6-tym łyku byłem w stanie cokolwiek napisać. Sue jest tak nieziemsko gładkie w odbiorze. Początkowa wyraźna słodowa baza po kilku pierwszych haustach zostaje wypierana przez solidne nachmielenie.
Słodsze owoce (mango, papaja) w miarę upływu czasu przechodzą w cytrusy (pomarańcze, mandarynki, ananasy, grejpfruty).
Żywiczne nuty wspaniałe współgrają z korzennymi i ziołowymi klimatami.
Goryczka jak na APA jest dość wysoka o grejpfrutowym profilu. Sam finisz jest jednak krótki, bardzo przyjemny.
Piwo ma średnią teksturę i jest umiarkowanie wysycone.
Odczucie w ustach jest wytrawne, gładkie, kremowe.
Trunek rozpływa się w ustach. Jest gigantycznie pijalny, nieziemsko sesyjny. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:   

Toppling Goliath stanął na wysokości zadania i sprostał swojej legendzie.
Uraczył mnie jednym z najlepszych piw w tym stylu jakie piłem.
Największą zaletą pseudoSue jest jej lekkość i łatwość degustacji, przy jednoczesnym zachowaniu wspaniałego balansu między słodową bazą, chmielem i krótką, zrównoważoną goryczką.
To taki trunek, który można pić litrami od śniadania, do kolacji i nigdy się nie znudzi.

16 oz can poured, with huge thanks to Nacho Cat for the share! Pleasant treat for sure! Hazy golden pour with a thick foam head. Super Midwest pale here. Grainy aroma, more subtle grapefruit hop impressions. Flavor is a more onion like hop quality, soft citrus to pair. Similar to other regional pales, in my opinion. Refreshing. Very easy drinking pale here. Tasty.

Can bought back by Matt from Minnesota. Love that Sue the Chicago Field Museum tyrannosaur gets a namesake beer! Pours a clear bright orange-copper with a creamy fizzy white head. Amazing aroma: smells of citrus and tropical fruits, orange floral hop, very perfumed, a bit woody, faint vanilla, spicy biscuit malt. Taste is dry and bitter, spicy amber malt, big but a little thin/watery in the finish and compared to the nose. Body is quite bitter, watery but very smooth/creamy, lightly sweetish spicy frothier malt finish. Excellent - bright and fresh tasting, big but still refined/smooth.
Can at home. Hazy gold with a big fluffy head. Ripe mango, citrus, and dark honey on the nose. Sweet and fruity, stonefruits, citrus, perfumey hops. Dry but fruity finish. Solid but not mindblowing.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 Can from CB3 in Rochester MN. Slightly hazy golden orange pour with puffy dense head. Looks good. Aroma is lemon zest pine and biscuit malt. Taste is deep pine bitterness with some citrus. Smooth palate and balanced malt. Very good APA/IPA but maybe had too high expectations? Would get again though.

Pours bright golden, bit of foam. Tropical fruit nose, sweet and fresh cut grass. Taste is hippy, light and herbal. Has some nice pine character. Citric. Beautiful aromatic pale ale. Something I could just keep drinking without getting tired of it.

This is a good if unexceptional IPA. Its a hazy pale orange color w/ a fine-bubbled white head. I am getting a sort of foxy concord grape character out of this and a good deal of sweet citrus as well. Its only a touch sweet but fairly full-bodied and oily in texture. This is nice and bitter with a hint of a minty herbal sort of note in the finish which I am not 100% crazy about. Still, this stuff is nice and hoppy and perfectly drinkable. Id get it all the time if I didnt have quite a few local options I liked better.

Porus a hazy nice orange with golden hues and a medium white head. Aroma is nice orange with pineapples. Flavor is same fruity juiciness with orange, pineapples, peaches and some mango at the end. Nice slightly bitter aftertaste. Medium to light body, really refreshing and tasty.

Some pine, grapefruit aromas. Deep yellow color with a huge tanish head. Jan 26/17 date...some fine particles floating about. Sweet up front. Caramel, mixed with pine, grapefruit tones. Watery mouthfeel and muddled finish. Bitterness is dry and flat. Not sure if bad batch or what but average.
From can to pint glass. Slightly hazy orange-gold with full white head. Overt citrus and slight pine. Moderate bitterness and a solid malt backing of cracker. Not overpowering, but solid.

$9/4-pack of 16floz cans purchased in St. Louis Metro East area. Dated 02.01.2017. Consumed 03.16.2017 from an imperial nonic glass. This beer meets the hype as a superb example of an APA. Gold in body topped with two-fingers worth of head. Smells like a musty grapefruit (in a good way). A hopped forward beer where grapefruit and pine battle it out over just enough graininess from the malts. Initial mouthfeel is wet, but it leaves a long dry finish. Although, good in a way, the residual bitterness prevents me from awarding a couple more points. Ive had other citra hop beers providing similar characteristics, yet this one has done the best job.

16 oz. can pours a clear golden with lasting foamy white head and clumps of lacing. Nose is strong. Aroma is full of tropical and citrus fruits with some pine. Taste is bitter with only a slight hint of sweet malts in the middle before a long dry finish. Body is medium with average carbonation and a sticky yet crisp mouthfeel. Easily drinkable, despite a wallop of fruitiness. A great American Pale Ale, right up there with Alpha King and Zombie Dust.
Pours deep golden in an off white head. Stale hops, citrus and earth. Moderate bitterness. From mikkeler bar in San Fran. Could have been fresher
16oz can from tavour. Bit of smooth hops with a little sweetness. Orange vitamin c flavoring with a touch of resin. Pretty good but could be better.
16oz can from my mom. Made on dec 20th 2016. Minty citrus. Reminds me of Zombie Dust which I had a couple nights ago. Definitely balanced with a grapefruit finish. No ABV listed on can.
Bright gold and clear with a persistent white foam. Im a fan of the Citra hop with its citrus and grapefruit flavors. Not too bitter. Easy to drink!
On tap. Very smooth and smooth sessionable pale ale, certainly on par with Alpha King A true gem of a pale ale.

Clear golden with a light, white head. Fairly prominent lacing. Bright lemon citrus, mango, some slightly dank pine resin. Fairly bitter, stronger malt backbone than the last batch tasted in ~2014, some biscuit. Medium body, fair bit of carbonation, not exceptionally clean. Long lingering finish, citrus rind. Great.
Pours a very cloudy golden with a white head. Clean fresh nose of pine, lemon, and garlic. Resinous, yet crisp mouthfeel. Pine and citrus flavors. Aromas are more vibrant than the flavor.

Can from Bottlecraft North Park, San Diego. Hazy golden with a small head. Fresh with hops, pineapple, mango, some lime and hints of malt. The body was on the light side and the bitterness around medium. Really refreshing and easy to drink. A great one.

Pours a bright, clear golden with a foamy, medium white head that settles slowly. The robust aroma is full of citrus hops, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, and hints of caramel. The taste is quite dry with just a tiny initial sweetness. It gushes with flavor. Strong grapefruit is the dominating flavor, with lesser notes of pine, resin, pineapple, citrus hops, mild herbal hops, and hints of caramel. The aftertaste is a vary long pineapple, Extremely easy to drink, this one is light to medium in body, sticky in texture, with some lively carbonation. Absolutely delicious, I would never get tired of this.
Not much to say about this one. Its a citra-hopped pale ale; pretty basic, nothing special. IDK what the hypes about.
Balance towards the bitterness, quite harsh with noticeable malt backbone, maybe too old.

A rarity of a brew making its way out here to the California Central Valley. Bright and greasy citrus and light tropics involved here. Delicious and dank. Fresher from the can. Super hyped to be associated with trying something from the renowned Toppling Goliath.

A lot of Citra notes right when the can is open. Has a beautiful golden hue to it with sediment lingering towards the bottom of the glass. Lack of a head. Really a great beer, tasty, refreshing and just the right amount of hops. Happy that Toppling Goloath has finally made it east of the Mississippi River.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Can, many thanks to Mike from Mon Petit Café for the trade! Hazy orange color with eggshell white head. Aroma is piney, bready, citrus, citrus leafs, hugely aromatic. Taste is citrus, some tropical fruits, bready malt body. Oily, rather light-bodied mouthfeel with low to medium carbonation. This really is a gem. The can was not fresh, but still an extremely nice APA - this must be absolutely stellar fresh.
16oz can bright orange with foamy white head lots of citrus with a nice hoppy finish awesome beer
Some carbonation with lots of sediment. Smell is classic Citra: juicy sweet orange with some grass/pine notes. A little sweet with a lingering mango finish. Solid body, oily mouthfeel. Pretty good.

First rating on Ratebeer goes to this gem of an APA. Aroma heavy on citrus. Appearance a slightly darkened gold with a nice milky head. Taste hits like an IPA but smoothed out to release the grapefruit on the palate. Seeing that its a single hop makes me want to raid the scotch shelf at the local liqqie. Love this beer, and you will too

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 16 oz can. Pours golden yellow with a billowy three finger head. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, pineapple. Taste is a mild grapefruit and grass with a semi-dry finish. Thin-medium bodied with excellent carbonation. The aroma, taste, and body all blend together perfectly. Overall this is my new #1 pale ale, replacing zombie dust on my list. Excellent brew from TG.

2015 BJCP Category: 18B: American Pale Ale
AROMA: Potent hop aromas of mostly citrus but also grass/spice rack. There is an underlying sweetness of pale malt, but nothing distinctive. 10/12APPEARANCE: Mostly clear amber/light copper color. Large off-white froth retains and laces well. 3/3FLAVOR: Moderately-high hop flavor right away. Taste is akin to citrus juice concentrate at first with a grassy sensation on the finish with a touch of onion or garlic powder. Mildly sweet honey malt backbone provides balance. Bitterness is quite strong; this could possibly be considered an IPA. 17/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium body; medium-high CO2. Mouthfeel is fairly crisp and not as thick as an IPA proper. Very quaffable for 5.8% ABV (temptingly sessionable). Refreshing while in the mouth. Hops linger momentarily leaving a slightly dry/pasty sensation. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: A fantastic pale ale that tastes great and is fun to drink. Can also work as an IPA if you want it to. 9/10TOTAL SCORE: 43/50
Can at home. Golden brown color with great sense off white head. This beer has gusto!

Can at home. Pours clear dark gold with a large, frothy white head, medium retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is heavy, fragrant tangerine, orange, pineapple and mango hops with some early dank catty notes and medium cracker malt. Flavor is juicy tangerine and mango hops and moderate bitterness, medium cracker malt, some dank and catty hop notes with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
Love this beer! Crisp grapefruit flavors with a tropical punch. Wish I could have this all the time! Great label too.
Tap - fist size foamy head, slightly hazy dark straw color, very big grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, mold may backbone, juicy and moldy bitter hop finish, very good overall
Can. Pours nice clear oanrge. The aroma is huge. Big hoppy citrus and orange. The plate is juicy and wet. The taste is big orange and grapefruit. Awesome beer
Poured milky orange amber with a small off white froth. Aroma of moderately sweet citrus over soft malt. Medium body, flavour of orange and light tropical citrus. Bitter sweet finish.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2016 Felt like I needed to adjust my score. Working through a 4 pack of tallboy cans and this stuff is pretty special. One thing I missed somehow the first time - the palate is perfect: medium, creamy, gulpable. We fought over these and it would live in my rotation if I could get it. ORIGINAL RATING 11/11/16: Courtesy of Wilkes and Lynn from Target in Wesley Chapel, FL. This was done locally at Brew Hub and they swear its not as good as one from brewery. Anyway... gold pour, thin white head. aroma of tropical fruit, grassy, toffee. tastes are melon, citrus, grain malts, grapefruit, mango. sticky palate.

Poured into a becher pint glass, the appearance was a golden burnt amber color with a foamy to bubbly white head that quickens the pace of letting the lace of being messy all over.
The aroma starts off with some sharp bitter pineu hops purely agitating a sly earthy sweet malt. Citrus hops slyly move in for a subtle balance.
The flavor balances quite nicely between the piney bittersweet hops and citrus hops. Malt level seems to lay back a tad bit more. Pineyness grips the aftertaste and leads on into the finish. 
On the palate, this one leans to the lighter side between light and medium bodied. Low carbonation yields to the hops embracing a keen bitterness as the harshness punctuating my tongue.
Overall, what a damn American Pale ale, that I would love to have again. Awesome in its entirety and purely substantial with whatever food one would want with it.

Fresh can. Clear burnt orange with a thick white head and great lacing. Aroma is a huge tropical overload. Mango, pineapple, grapefruit, and Citra hops. Taste is juicy with mango, papaya, grapefruit, orange, and pine. Very juicy with a dry finish. Outstanding.
Very sharp hop aromas that blend to this strong honey smells. Clear golden with light ring of head. Soft body of mild astringent hops melts through your tongue. Light grain. Light Bitter.

Can shared at au revoir Tokyo. Thanks Kaori (and Jon? though I believe Kaori maintained this was from her private stash hehe). Anyway thanks for sharing. Big tropical fruit-forward nose with guava and mango dominating. Some grapefruit as it warms alongide other citrus and some dank weed notes. Light and crisp on the palate with great carbonation and more lingering tropical fruit notes. Light, prickly bitter finish, but not overly so. Great stuff!
Can. Golden color. Pleasant aroma: mango and passion fruit, papaya, lychee, very fruity, slightly citrus. Taste: juicy nectar, tropical fruits, pleasant bitterness, very good.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 Big thanks to Adrian, and to Todd also. This is as good a PA as I have had in a long time. Wow (shake of the head). Complex and delicious - some fresh fruit, grapes, applesauce, and pine. Well balanced with a smooth, cedary nip. A dash of molasses and leafy greens. Strong and pleasurable, welcome any time even if it pushes things a bit. I was surprised to find that this is a single hop brew - citra. Superb all the way thru!

Thanks Virby44 for the can! Poured into a snifter showing moderately filtered orange peel with white foam round the rims. 

The nose shows generous notes of tropical fruit - mango, pineapple, with lighter hints of guava and cannabis. 

The palate is medium bodied and fully carbonated. Flavors of the same tropical fruit with a moderate intensity showing throughout and continuing until the finish with a slight reveal of bready malts on the linger. A very light harmonious bitter tinges towards the end to make you remember its a pale ale. Linger leaves all those lovely tropical fruit notes tempting you for another sip.

Nose of citra hops - juicy fruit, grapefruit, dank followed by caramel, marmalade, and bread notes. Pours hazy golden orange, nice white head and lace. Flavors of caramel, marmalade, dank citra hops, some citrus and juicy fruit but mostly dank and earthy in the finish. Well made but maybe a little too much sweetness for a pale ale for my true appreciation though. Still well done and solid.

Can, bought @HJ Hansen, Odense. Pours murky dark yellow with a small, staying creamy white head. Aroma has lots of fresh citrus hops, mango, grapefruit, resin, hops oils. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, light biscuity bite, lovely hops balance, grapefruit, grass, mango, light bergamot. Great lingering bitterness. Very lovely overall.

Burk i Järnaviks naturvårdsområde. Finfin doft av blommor o citrus. Smaken mycket bra balanserad med citrus som ligger i bakvattnet o skvalpar. Eftersmaken mycket trevlig med en bra beska som gör detta till en världsöl i pale ale klassen.

Can thanks to Jeff. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head. A big fresh hop meaty nose. The flavor is caramel, toffee, big citrus, very clean. Light tropical notes, even some resin. Very good.

Stone fruit bottle share on 8/27. 22oz bottle thanks to Steve. Cloudy pale golden pour with slight off white bubbly head. Citrusy aroma, grapefruits, hints of pine. More of the Citra hops in the taste, minor malt notes in the background. Although not overly hoppy, for an APA, this one does focus squarely on the hops.

Bottle share, thanks to Steve. Pours a bright golden orange with a modest head. Aroma is big with citrus fruit; lots of grapefruit, and pine. Flavorful with hops, there is a moderate level of fruity sweetness and big hoppy bitters. Finishes surprisingly smooth, for such a bold level of bitterness this was very easy drinking.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Can. Thanks!

Re-rate thanks to Matt Lutton! I had more of this and feel I can give a better opinion of it now that Ive had more than a couple oz in a tasting.

A: Semi clear orange, thin white head head. 

N: Pine, soap, grapefruit, lemon rind, earth, damp leaves, pineapple, and biscuit. I find that this about does it for the flavors and they arent quite as rich as I remember.

T: Huge bitterness, soft sweetness.

M: No alcohol, medium body, spritzy carbonation. Pretty dry beer.

O: Quite good but dropping it down a few points after having a chance to really investigate it. Still easy drinking with good flavor, but after having the Cryo Pale from Pfriem, I wouldnt put this on the same level flavorwise. Still a well composed pale, though.

Vielen Dank an Erzengel! Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit mittelgroßen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach citrusfrüchten, angenehm hopfig bitter. Geschmack dezent hopfig bitter, fruchtig, Aprikosen, leicht harzig, okay!

Sweet citrus and tropical fruits, passion fruit, sweet orange, some grapefruit, overripe papaya. Clear gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light bitter and sweet. More citrus fruits, but also some floral hops, hay, straw, soft to medium carbonation, quite intense bitters developing, grapefruit, dry and bitter finish. Outstanding APA, excellent complexity in aroma and palate. Keg at brewery taproom, Decorah, IA.

Great fresh and floral nose. The beer starts fresh, round and intense floral. Very dry in body, hints of grain, fresh with lots of pine in the mouthfeel. Dry bitter and nice fresh floral aftertaste. Very crisp brew, round and refreshing! Nice hop profile!

Golden color with a white head, good retention with nice lacework. Aroma is hoppy, very fresh, notes of grapefruit, light citrus and some tangerine. Flavor with a good bitterness, medium maltiness, herbal notes with fruity hints. Enjoyable beer with a good bitterness on palate.

16 oz can, canned 7/5/16. Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a big bubbly white head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is bready malts and lots of dank resiny hops with a little fruit, pepper and pine.

The flavor is sweet bready malts and fruit with lots of dank resiny piney hops. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, very nice, more like an IPA.

16 ounce can from Trigs in Wausau, WI (July 2016), consumed at slightly above fridge temp from a Guinness pint glass. Oily-hazy bright, almost luminous gold body is topped by a large frothy slow-diminishing off-white cap, which leaves thick foam gouts in the glass....aroma is expectedly fruity/citric (orange, grapefruit) but also resinous/piney and interestingly funky/sweaty, with some lovely spicy hints (cinnamon) to round it out; its hugely brash and potent and that odd mixture really works...in the mouth it feels just a tad watery at first, but the body seems to get stronger towards the finish; its rather acidic and certainly quite hoppy for an APA, but I think keeps it tamped down enough to qualify for the style as opposed to an IPA - the malts are in the end more pronounced, and though theres a bit of caramel, and just a touch of syrupy alcoholic feel, the end product is extraordinarily drinkable and the sweet-dry balance is to my taste nearly perfect for this kind of beer. I drank two of these suckers in about half an hour without even thinking about it, now Im going to have to struggle to make dinner. But worth it, and a beer that deserves its marks here I think.

Canned, 500 ml from Svijet Piva. Shared with JFK10000 and Miro B. Pours clear orange with small frothy white head. Hoppy aroma, bit perfumy, pine, citrus, grapefruit. Long lasting, heavy bitterness. Dry finish. Medium bodied. Great.

Can. Pours out a mostly clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of citrus meat, grapefruit, light orangy/tangerine, some mild grainy bread notes and a touch of earthy hops. Taste is solid, very easy drinking. Notes of citrus peel, tangerine, light grapefruit pulp, some tropical notes, grainy bread and some light sweet malty notes. Really solid.

thanks to maniac for the share in 7/2016
Poured cloudy gold. Nose picked up citrus, grapefruit, peach and woody pine or citrus. started sweet but not too much and then a trickle of bitter at the end. Good beer!

650 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 10/11/2013. Hazy bright orange. Nice white head. Great lacing after the head settles. Strong mango and melon aroma. Orange and tropical fruit. All hops. Taste is more mango. Sweet citrus hop. Sweet pale malt. Slight grain. Just a ton of delicious citra hop goodness. Thick for a pale ale, but I like it. Creamy. Medium low carbonation. This is ridiculously good. Very few breweries make a pale ale anywhere near as good as this.

can dated 6/9 poured into a tulip glass..golden pour with a fluffy white head..
aroma of grapefruit,tangerine,cracker malt..tastes like it smells..well done.
RBSG 2016, hotel lobby share. Can. Slightly hazy gold. Massive resinous, hoppy body, so much foresty pine. Slightly medicinal bitter finish. Outstanding.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
From a can on the bus back from DLD. How did this not get consumed earlier? Fantastic well thought out IPA... I must visit this brewery!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at Mikkeller Bar, march 24th 2016. Hazy golden body with a lasting white head. Aroma is a citrus and grapefruit bomb with hay, mild grass and pine. Taste is super fresh and crisp, the citra really shows its best side here, peach and grapefruit for the most with a tropical medium bitter finish. The aftertaste is so juicy youre almost afraid of taking another sip to destroy whats going on in the mouth. Nice!

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 pours golden color, clear, almost brilliant, with lasting white foamy head. Aroma: intense hop aroma, which takes on pine, citruses, like lime, grapefruit....flavor: rich hop flavors, with notes of citruses, pine, supported with malt flavor, which steps forward in second half, and takes on toffee. Finish is slightly bitter. Body is medium, texture soft. carbonation is medium. Body, palate nad abv. like ipa?
Thanks Joe! Bottle (a tad old), but still nice pale that had plenty of citra pop with some mango and orange flavors, mildly bitter and nice crisp finish. Great APA

Bit hazy golden color, medium sized white head. Aroma of pine, lots of hops, some mango. Reminds me of Brewdogs Jack Hammer. Taste is also great, pine with decent amount of bitterness. Thin body, average carbonation. Very very tasty. One of the best APAs I had so far. //0,4 can from Svijet Piva

17 day old can mail ordered from France44.com into a stange.
A: Giant merengue head atop a clear gold body with slow bubbles. Long head retention and thick lace
S: Sharp sweet grapefruit scent with toffee/honeysuckle faintly in the background.
T: Bitter and piney becoming fruity with tropical and citrus notes. Pith and zest. A slightly astringent "green" note assumed from alcohol. 
M: Light medium body with nice carb tingle. Slight resin finish.
O: Good pale ale but worth nowhere near the hassle required to get it. I will enjoy my remaining 3 cans but likely will not ever buy again.

From a tall boy can. I did not expect to come across this in Southwest Florida. Orange, with a thin but very dense white head. Smells like toffee, with tropical citrus and some grassy notes. Pleasantly heavy palate. Its nicely hop-forward, with citrus and grassy flavors. Theres a nicely undercurrent of toffee and caramel, as well. Good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Draft at Nova?s in WI. A personal favorite, this just always hits the spot. Tons of citrus, a nice hop backbone, juicy with a touch of bitterness and not overly resiny. If you see it, grab some.

Can pour - clear orange with a frothy white head that maintains a ring throughout the drink - mild lacing. Aroma is citra hop forward, yet not overpowering - hint of piney hops as well...malt working in the background - nice stuff, albeit not particularly remarkable. Flavor is a bit more mild on the bitterness scale than anticipated...again, the citra hops shine...biscuity malt in the background - finishes with a strong dose of bittering hops. Palate is medium bodied and appropriate for a style. Maybe a bit disappointed with the expectations provided by the percentile on RB, but all in all this is a solid APA...nothing more...nothing less.

Can, 16oz. Sparkling clear golden with a frothy/creamy offwhite head . Sharp citrus and tropical hoppy aromas. Medium bodied, moderate to fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Intense fruity flavors into a stinging finish. Unique and amazing.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden beer with a small white head. Fruity aromas, especially of guava, hops and citrics. Taste is moderately bitter and moderately sweet. Light to medium bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Very sweet aftertaste and very fruity, especially of guava and papaya.

Canned 01/29/2016 - Pleasant fruitiness e.g. orange/tangerine from both the hops & fermentation. Clean balanced bitterness with just a touch of graininess. Lighter side of medium bodied. Finishes juicy & refreshing. Cheers!
Love this beer. Amazing taste. Perfect balance of flavor and mouth feel. Great appearance and really nice lacing.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Courtesy of Brandon
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate tropical fruits, mango, mild citrus, and dank hops 
It pours a transparent golden-orange with a small white head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of citrus and faint tropical fruits. The finish has grapefruit, lemon peel, and dank hops. Its light-medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation.

16 oz can. Lots of citrus aroma and citrus, pine resin and some pepper on the taste. Malt balance is perfect for a pale ale, but with the relative intensity of the hops, it would be spectacular if it had a bit more malt sweetness (though I guess that would make it of an IPA). Reminds me a lot of Three Floyds Zombie Dust.
Aroma is very citrusy and reisiny. Appearance is a golden yellow color. Flavor is malty and bitter. Some orange peel, lemon, and some lime? Overall a great pale ale.

Foamy head that disappears quickly
the beer is light golden with a bit of haze.

Sweet aroma with slight fruit, bit of malt and a hint of dank.

the taste is piney with grape and some sweetness. Im getting som mango but is also sensing some malty sweetness.

The end is bitter with a good balance. The aftertaste is plesant.

The can is 6 month old. Perhaps it has lost
some of the fruityness.

A Nice beer that is easy to drink.. its in good balance but does not seem that complex.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This bottled brew from a rating party poured a head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a uncarbonated transparent yellow orange colored body and a fair lacing. The mild aroma was hoppy. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish hoppy aftertaste. The ok flavor contained notes of hops. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

My new favourite IPA. Big juicy bomb and not overpowering in the IBU. Why dont you sell in Ontario though? Man this is good. Juicy citrus hops, sweet malt. Nicely balanced to let the hops shine. I can stick my nose in this all day. Thanks to VanJammer for this.

16oz can. Medium off-white head that leaves nice lacing, atop clear light amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, orange/tangerine, light grapefruit, pineapple. Taste is moderately sweet, tangerine, some orange, light grapefruit, pineapple. Light-medium body, light stickiness.
Can. Golden color, clear liquid, white heard. Aroma of fresh hops. Finish is sweet with first sips, but continues to more bitter, again and again, more bitter and bitter. Tasty.
One of my favorite single hopped APAs. Excellent dank and citrus aromas clean ballanced beer with only slight bitter finish.

Amarelada de leve turbidez, espuma de média, formação e persistência. Aroma carregado de lúpulo, tangerina, abacaxi. Paladar de médio amargor, leve dulçor. Corpo leve, média carbonatação. Final de média persistência, mantém o cítrico e lupulado, tangerina fica mais evidente. Ótima drinkability.
Straw yellow with white head. Dank, green hops, citrus and pine. Light, Hoppy, dry and fruity finish. Overall: fruity and light body.
Aroma of grapefruit & orange. Hazy yellow with quickly disappearing white head. Taste of bitter grapefruit. Medium body, thin texture & average carbonation.

16oz can. HUGE thanks to TheHoff for my first TG beer! Pours a slightly hazy burnt orange color with a finger of frothy white head. Aroma of sweet citrus and tropical fruits, hints of pine, grapefruit skins, resin, and caramel malts. Taste mimics the nose. Great balance. Solid beer!

16 oz can. Pours in cloudy golden with a large white head. Aroma is citrus, mango, grapefruit, apricot and pine notes. Pretty well carbonated with flavours of citrus, pine, grapefruit, apricot with a clear mango and bitter finish! A really nice well balanced beer.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2016 From Labirratorium. In Teky glass. Watching Vinkings 4x10. Amazing in all aspects, but specially on texture, oily, with each sip filling your mouth completely, and very balanced. One of those brews that causes you great sorrow when then glass have finally em! ptied

I think of this as a west coast style pale ale, though of course that makes little sense geographically. Nonetheless, it reminds me of the balance and drinkability of a Sierra Nevada with the tropical and citrus fruit turned up to 11. Very enjoyable.
Hazy yellow orange pour with a white head and great lacing. Aroma is grapefruit zest, topical fruit and pine. Taste is grapefruit juice, citrus zest, peach and some toffee. Light body.

Can. Light amber body with large white head. Aroma is citrus fruits pines with hints of herbs. Taste is nearly the same but with more citrus and pines. Aftertaste is medium bitter nice balanced by fruity malts. Perfekt.
Cans. Post-10K race beer. Pours a deep hazy amber body with thick lacing. Notes of dusty citrus, juicy hop profile, melon and strawberry. For a 7-week old can, not too bad.
Annanas, citrus, licht gras... smaak is subtiel bitter zoet, body is perfect mediumzwaar.. beste ipa in tijden... lange complexe bitter fruitige afdronk

Canned 03/22/16. Pours medium opacity honey orange, off-white frothy head. Aroma is an excellent example of citra single hop. The orange, tangerine, mango, theres a bit of peach I wanna say, definitely a nice sugar sweetness to it, pine, slightly floral, nice tropical fruit too. Im astounded at the complexity of this for a single-hop. Im not sure what the malt bill is, but this is exceptional smelling. Flavor is wow, a lot of pine and dankness. Its like a dank christmas tree, mango, grapefruit, orange, slight sweetness. Ive had a lot of "great" hoppy beers. Some are highly rated probably because of their balance. Two hearted IPA, Stone IPA, NoDa Hop Drop n Roll. Theyre excellent IPAs, but not because they pop, because theyre balanced. I totally expected this to just be a regular balanced APA with some orange and nice citrus notes. I really didnt expect this complex and phenomenal beer. Im not sure why its an APA vs. an IPA, but thats for another time. Its really impressed me so much more than I expected it to. Other than Hill Farmstead Mosiac Single hop, this is the next best APA Ive had I think at this point. Cheers to you, PseudoSue.

475 ml can, canned Jan 16, courtesy of Werckmeister, many thanks!
Golden-amber, medium hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of citrus, apricot, orange, passion fruit, pineapple, some flowers, some pine, biscuit.
Taste follows this, with some more grapefruit.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, medium dry, with long-lasting piney and citric notes.

Really tasty. Very fresh, crisp and easy drinkable, with loads of lovely citric notes. Great showcase for one of my favourite hop variants, straight, perfectly balanced, with just enough malt body. Not my favourite APA (at least at 4 months old), but just how I want this style.

Can. Deep gold color with thick white head and lacing. Pine aroma. Pine and fruit upfront. Body a little thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazed, light amber color with a tallish cream colored head. Grapefruit, pithy orange, pure raw hops, and hints or caramel malt. If you light fresh hops scents, this is for you. I would prefer a bit more malt and balance, but it is what it is. Soft feel. Light pine, red grapefruit, mild peaches and hint of circus peanuts. I like the freshness, but am trying to understand the love for this one. Perhaps a bit of underdog appreciation, as I remember the love for other small local upstart. Dont get me wrong, a well brewed hoppy ale, but 4+? Im struggling. Raw barley and vanilla lurk in the back ground. Some tea and lemon in the linger. 4/14

Citra Citra Citra! Always what I'm in search of. Lacks the aroma and a little butter versus citrus than I'd expect - that's what stops the perfect score. If I could only find in Chicago.

Can in Wisconsin.

A/A+

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can to tulip. Pours hazy gold, white froth head. Aroma of spruce, grapefruit, hop spice. Taste of same with great body and malty sweetness showing through. Super balanced. Great showcase of Citra!

Can. As solid of a beer this is, it is NOT the best pale ale out there. At least the one month old cans didnt show this. maybe fresh tap would. Nose is floral lite pine, grapefruit, nothing really all that special but solid. Very bright floral flavors, lots of lemon, somewhat tart hop flavors. Mild bitterness, mostly lemon citric almost a cleaner-esque hop profile on the finish. Nice toasted malt base does show here, giving some nice sweetness. Solid but its not the best.

Deep golden light haze offering a medium light creamy white head with very good lacings. Aromas of mango, citrus with a soft touch of caramel and ripe papaya, flowery and dried lime peel. Soft carbonation, lean and smooth texture, bright and crisp body. Harmonic and balanced with a caramel toasty sweetness and a flowery light piney and tropical fruit hop bite. Medium lasting finish - quaffer!
Bottle. Cloudy golden pour with a white head. Aroma is grassy, fresh, bright, some citrus zest. Taste is the same; fresh and grassy with some citrus zest, slightly dry finish. Excellent pale ale.

Dåse. Orangefarvet klar øl med et fint skumhoved. Meget sødlig humlet duft. Meget dominerende og næsten for pungent for mig. Forskellen på 4 og 3,8. Smagen er også pungent med en dominerende humle. Overraskende meget bitterhed der gør den drikbar. Superfin øl.

16oz can at home. Canned 01/15/2016. orange light hazy color, medium big white head. smells of resin, toffee, light herbal, light exotic fruits. overall good smell but not very impressive. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of resin, pines, nice exotic fruits, lightly citric, some grapefruit, pineapple, toffee, light currant notes, peppery, lemon grass, a bit stale hoppy towards the finish. finishes light to medium bitter with notes of resin and lemon grass. overall good stuff, but was expecting quite a bit more. rather heavy for a pale ale (more ipa-ish).

16 oz can to pint glass (from FL; canned MAR/09/16). Looks good; a very slightly hazy golden orange with foamy eggshell head. Smells of bitter and citrus hops with a moderately bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly bitter medium-bodied mouthfeel. A touch of caramel on the tongue as it warms as well. Good beer that Id like to revisit super-fresh.

Dont see an abv on the can, but 7% begs the question - wheres the line between APA and IPA? This drinks like an IPA, though not very bitter. A smorgisboard of citrusy aroma and flavor - grapefruit, orange, pineapple - perhaps even hints of papaya and mango and evergreen. Really nice, crushable yet has a huge flavor.

can from kihoskh. clear golden, fluffy white head.
delicate flowery very pleasant fresh hoppy aroma with bitter notes and a faint malty touch. aroma appear very dry, fresh and appetizing. not much oranges or exotic going on, i like those things not to be there.
flavor is peppery, bitter hoppy with a touch of flowers and citrus and pine, a little bit of sweetness that i could do without, but at least the sweetnes is flowery and not corn or something like that. beer go a bit too close to malty bittersweet cloying , but stays just clear of that area. Very heavy taste for the abv. easy drinking, very good APA.

Fresh can courtesy of Clint (starcross) -- cheers, buddy! Its a Citra single-hop pale ale, so its no surprise that its pretty similar to Zombie Dust. Theres a good citrusy aroma and a moderate amount of bitterness that really tied everything together. Is it overhyped? I dont know, probably. But it is definitely one heck of a good beer.
Canned january, hops might be diminished, some sweet hoppy notes in the aroma. Taste is medium bitter light sweetness, hoppy bitter finish. Good beer.
Can at mikkeller bar, copenhagen. Hazy dark golden color, white head. Aroma has citrus, hops, malty sweetness, some mango notes. Balanced hoppy profile, good palate, hoppy end, grapefruit. Tasty.

Canned 453ml. -Courtesy of franski, shared with him, Marko and kajser27. Golden coloured, small white head, strong hoppy nose. Moderate malty, grapefruity and fruity hoppy, light herbal with odd touch of zucchini. Hoppy finish. Very good but not great.

Can from a friend. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, floral hops, resin, mango, peach and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, floral hops, mango, peach, resin and grass. Exquisite brew.

From a can, having become more easily available in Europe now since part of Toppling Goliaths production is made at another brewery - and that goes for this can as well. Medium thick, off-white, lacing head, hazy golden blonde robe with greenish hue. Dank IPA aroma of lemongrass, grapefruit flesh, tropical flowers, some hops urine, mandarin, mango, lychee, passion fruit, green banana, white bread, butter. Fruity, crisp onset, clean with lively green banana, mango, lychee and passion fruit sweetishness and sourishness, medium carbo just fit for the style, clean and smooth pale malt sweetishness leading to a long, very aromatically and softly but thoroughly bittering hop finish with lots of retronasal floral, citrusy and piney aromas. This is a beautiful IPA indeed, and the first Toppling Goliath beer I encounter which is more or less worth the hype.

Lata, @La Buena Cerveza, Madrid. 09/04/2016. Canned: 06/01/2016
Color amarillo, aromas frutales, sabor resinoso, final amargo

Light gold, frothy head, fine carbonation. Candy sweet malts that show of the citra hop profile and its lovely tropical flavors. Deliciouso. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can, 16 oz as Toppling Goliath pseudoSue Pale Ale, no ABV, canned Jan 2016. Clear orange, a few bubbles, dense cratered off-white head. Aroma is mango, red onion chutney, chai latte. Body is fairly light, tingly carbonation, quite smooth. Taste is spicy, peach, onion, candied orange, straw, a touch of buttery malt. Nice and hoppy and extremely drinkable. A pretty accomplished APA (more like IPA).

Amber-deep golden colored, clear, small+ white frothy head. Aroma is some caramel malt background, strong hoppy notes, tropical fruits, orange, pine and citrus. Taste is medium sweet caramalt, medium+ hoppy aroma, pine and tropical fruits, some citrus as well, medium bitterness, dry finish, fresh dry hopped, lasting hoppy aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, resiny. Clean, pleasant insane hoppiness... yes!
(can, Svijet Piva, Zagreb)

Can pour. Pale ale that rivals Zombie Dust. Aroma is a fantastic citrus and floral bouquet. Clear caramel color. Taste is dank. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle kindly shared byLukka19, many thanks. Golden color with thick white head. Strong citrus hoppy bitter aroma. Lovely citrus hoppy taste with oranges, tangerines, zest, pines. Solid caramel malty backbone. Long citrus hoppy bitter finish. Excellent beer.

Can. A bit hazy yellow golden colour. White head. Fresh hops aroma. Juice, tropical, citrus fruits. Grapefruit, passionfruit, pineapple. Taste is fresh hops, pineapple, grapefruit, some resin, pine. Some malty sweetness. Nice high bitterness. Very very good.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 Bottle, golden hazy color, medium white head. Aroma is light malty, floral, nice citrusy hoppy, zest, pines. Taste is fresh, drinkable, floral, citrusy, zesty, piney, earthy and grassy notes. Refreshing, easy drinkable

Bottle shared at a tasting. Clear yellow to golden colour. Slightly catty garlicy hoppy aroma, otherwise fruity and zesty. In taste it shows thin body, moderate to light high carbonation, very easy drinking. Juicy tasty hoppy complex flavour, lots of fruits, exotic, citrusy, quite good.
Can at home from drinkshop.sk. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, malt. Taste is bitter, lightly sweet, hoppy, citrusy, grapefruit, malt. Nice and easy drinkable.
Pours a yellow orange color. White head. Light body. Tons of fruit flavor, grapefruit, orange, mango, great hop flavor but not overpowering. Dry aftertaste with sweet flavor.
really fruity P.A. lemon and exotic fruit aromas with spicy hints. taste medium bitter, really balanced, medium bodied, with a soft bitter finish

UPDATED: APR 14, 2016 Can, brewed in Lakeland, FL. Huge thanks franski! Shared with him, ogivlado and kajser. 3 months old. Golden body, small white head. Herbal/fruit candy huge hoppy aroma, some maltiness underneath. Taste... pleasant, vinuous fruity hoppy taste, grapefruity, pleasant herbal notes, slightly sweetish maltiness underneath. Simple, yet very effective. Medium bitterness. This is an excellent APA, no doubt about it, slightly overrated perhaps because of the hype, but still a pretty damn lovely beer. Great job!

shared can, poured a slight hazy deep golden colour with a slight white head on top. nose of sweet juicy tropical fruits, mango, stone fruits, malts, citurs, clear malt precence, and a little bit harsh in the taste. slight resinous backbone. i think the original brew (not in florida) was a lot better. still very enjoyable.

From a can. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma is outstanding, stupidly fruity, with pineapple, papaya, grapefruit, mango, sweet citrus fruits, orange zest, bubblegum. Citra at its best. Taste follows the aroma, maybe less intense, but again, very tropical and citrusy, followed by a moderate but very integrated bitterness on the aftertaste.

Can. Pours a hazy amberish orange with a lasting thin white foamy to bubbly head. Aroma is of exotic fruits, passion fruit, mango, caramel, biscuits, oranges. Taste is of passionfruit, mango, melon, oranges, caramel. Chewy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Poured from 16 oz can dated 3/1/16 thanks Airforcehops (Chris) nice golden color with a nice one finger white head. Aromas of citrus mango and nice piney hops. Taste is awesome nice and balanced great citrus and floral notes with a smooth bitterness through the finish. Wow! Thanks for rate 800!!

Pours a slightly hazy gold. Thin white head that leaves sticky lacing. Juicy hop aroma with grass, citrus and mild pine. Immediate taste is a "dry" cracker or bready flavor. Turns "juicy" with tropical flavors. Grapefruit like bitterness in the finish.

Bottle - pours a medium gold . Pungent citrus aroma . Moderate bitterness . Tasty .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from M&F Bottle Shop, Copenhagen  fuzzy golden orange pour with large foamy off white head. Big bold fruity and hoppy, with a plethora of citrus and tropical fruits, grapefruit, mango and tangerine, biscuit malt backing, some pine, floral and herbal hoppy action, great hoppy finish. Very nice.

Can 0.5l at Small Ratebeer Gathering Amsterdam Netherlands.16.03.2016.Taste with adamnowek and Zlotta.Thanks Jan for this bottle.Pour it almost clear golden color with small white head.Aroma freesh fruity,orange feel.Smooth texture,taste perfectly fresh,lots of fruits,little bit harsh,finish with hoppy pleasent bitte flavor.Perfectly proper USA fresh APA.Nice

Can. A hazy golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of grass, hops, malt, and exotic fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, peaches, citrus fruits, malt, caramel, and hops, leading to a bitter finish.
26 mar 2016, can. Light gold. Nose is bitter pine hops and mildly sweet. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Sweet granola and sweet lemon juice. Ok.
Stable and fine foam. Aroma: grass, citrus, malts. Taste: medium bitterness, passion fruit, resiny, pinapple, mango. Great american pale ale!

On can at Örebro Ölcafé. Very fresh and hoppy smell with citrus, tropical fruits, pineapple, lime, mango and tropical fruits. Similar taste. Light body. Very fresh and hoppy. Clean hop aroma. Light-medium bitterness. Refreshing. Close to perfect. Loved this beer.

16 oz (1 pint) can from Mikkeller webshop. Pale orange gold colour, foamy white head leaving lacing and hoppy aroma with tropical fruits, mango & passionfruit, some citrus. Taste is bready biscuity malt caramel nicely balanced with sweetish tropical fruit, orange, grapefruit, and resiny hop bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy finish. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 Can, canned 15.01.2016 (from Mikkeller webshop). Pours dark golden with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is fruity, floral, citrus, biscuits. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, citrus, caramel, honey, some biscuity notes. Finish is dry-citric bitter with lingering caramel sweetness. Overall: the hops are already fading a bit, but this still damn nice.
Pours hazy gold with a medium fast disappearing white head. Aroma is garlic apricot and mango. Flavour is smooth and mango. Finish is slightly bitter, but very smooth and almost creamy.

Four pack purchased at HyVee in De Moines. Date stamped on can reads March 1, 2016, consumed 18 March 2016. Hazy pale golden color. Aroma shows light green scallions, tropical fruits and very subtle pine.

Thankfully the Citra doesnt come off as cat pee. More tropical fruits. The base is pale grain with a moderate amount of malt. Lucky it doesnt become overly malty. Light mango, pineapple and traces of herbal hops. This is a great beer without question but not sure what the huge hype was about? Maybe it really has changed since they are brewing this in Florida and having to ship it back to the local area.

473ml can. Minimally milky, yellow-ish golden colour with average to huge, thick, frothy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Piney, grassy and citrusy hoppy aroma, biscuity malty basis, notes of spruce, pineapple, passion fruit, hints of grapefruit and lemon. Taste is slightly sweet biscuity malty, mildly bitter, citrusy and piney hoppy, notes of pineapple and passion fruit, some grapefruit and lemon. Superbly balanced, excellent drinkability - a masterpiece.

16 Fl. Oz. Can. Poured hazy, golden with a nice thick off white head and some lacing. Aroma of fruit, malts and hops (lots of hops). Bitter, slightly sweet and malty, peach notes, caramel and grapefruit too. Dry but crisp; very enjoyable, great beer.

16 fl oz can from Saveur Bière shared at Markos place, canned in January 2016. Clear, golden yellow with a white head. Fruity-grassy, slightly herbal aroma of mango, pineapple, some passion fruit, grapefruit and hemp. Slightly bitter, grassy-fruity, slightly herbal taste of grapefruit, pomelo, pineapple, a bit of lemon and hemp, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, grassy-herbal finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Quite fresh, rather herbal, nicely balanced. Good!
Tallboy from zlotta at a tasting. Pretty clear golden colour. Aroma is herbal, with some hibiscus and a wee bit of grapefruit and turpentine. Taste has a lot of grapefruit.
Can. Pours golden with haze with off white head. Aroma is citrus grapefruit and pineapple. Taste is sweet grapefruit, pineapple and papaya with a bitter piney grapefruit finish. excellent.

16 oz can in a trade. Pours a thin golden color with a thin white head. Aromas of pineapple, mango, grapefruit, pine, and a slight onion aroma. Flavors of pineapple, orange, slight pine finish. Super juicy on the palate, slight dry hoppy bitter finish.

Can. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. To onedimensional to be truly great.

473ml can from shop.mikkeller.dk

Canned JAN/15/16


Pale golden colour with a big white head. Fresh feeling, hops, tropical ruits, resin. Very good drinkability.

Aroma of tangerines, general exotic fruits, massive citra notes. Taste is mango sweet with a topping of citradelic sting. Fresh and superbly made pale ale that makes you long for more. This is a winner!
Àmbar limpio y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas intensos y frescos de pomelo, menta, piña. Cuerpo medio maltoso, sabor intenso como en aroma y final de amargor resinosa medio aunque breve.

Canned. Golden coloured. Unclear. Denseoff white head. Aroma. Tropical fruits, flowers, herbs, grape, caramel, spicw. Flavour. Flowers, tropical fruits, sweetness, herbs, citrus, spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter. .
Canned. Single hop citra. Grass, resin, cat piss. Citra is a hop that Works better in a team!
Can to mouth. Smell and taste are citric and piney. Beautifully balanced and easy drinking. Very nice beer

Can at Mbargo, Stockholm. Canned 16 (?) january 2016.
Just slight misty golden with a nice thick two finger off white head that lace.
Very nice fresh hoppy aroma with lots of mango, tangerine, pine, yellow apples, light caramel and cookies. Pine/resin rises more when the glass is going empty.
Taste is fairly dry with just the right amount of malt sweetness to make it both drinkable and rich in flavour. Tangerine, mango, bloodorange, honey oat cookies, pine and some metallic/stone minerals. Medium to marked bitterness.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, soft oily texture.
Very nice and fresh APA. Drinkable but still quite flavourful.

Burk. Övervåningen pitchers örebro . Orangegul vätska. Fantastiskt fräsch och färsk humledoft. Ananas, blodapelsin och barr. Frisk och lite kryddig smak av grape, blodapelsin och färsk hö. Lättdrucken och inte på något sätt extrem i munkänslan. Kan dricka hur många som helst

Can at Bishops Folkis. Clear golden with creamy white head. Big aroma with mango, pine needles, pineapple and light grass. Fruity mango taste with some slight sweet grassy notes, lychee, pineapple orange and lemon zest. Perfectly balanced with a lightly zesty finish.

Can at home. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Dry with a mellow sweetness. Lots of sprucy and fresh hops aromas with some grass. Also notes of pale malts and knækbrød. Medium bodied with an oily palate. Medium carbonation. Dry finish.

Aroma of mango, a lot of mango before the tangerine and citrus explosion, Also little hint of piney and stone fruits, peach. Pale golden with frothy white head. Sweet malt impression after the first sip, but followed by mango and tangerine. Canned 1/5/16....drunk 2/27/16. Very generous extra from Rabbott2 (BA). Cheers man!Pours a clear copper with an off-white head that is large and steadily recedes to a ring.Citra, bright and clear in the nose, is backed by hay, biscuits and crackers. Seemingly very well attenuated and extremely clean. Absolutely no alcohol or off-flavors.In the mouth its got a round, lightly caramel-tinged maltiness with delicate, spicy citra notes, no cat pee, no heavy grapefruit and really just a lot of soft tangerine and lemon. Drinks very easily, with a soft, malty texture and fluffy, tight carbonation. Pretty fucking good and one of the more malty IPAs of recent memory, yet not sweet or overdone with the malt.Yes, I waited a bit too long on this guy (though you cant really tell, other than its just a little more malt-forward) but its really nice to see how pristine the actual beer is underneath the hops, which usually mask/distract from brewing imperfections. Toppling Goliath is certainly a fantastic brewery and has done just fine after their prior head brewers departure.

One of the premier candidates to the "only one beer for the rest of your life?" question. Very quaffable.

16 ounce can into pint glass, canned on 1/29/2016. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep golden/amber color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, passion fruit, lemon zest, orange peel, light pine, honey, light caramel, biscuit, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of juicy citrus/tropical hops and moderate dark/bready malt notes; with great strength, Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, passion fruit, lemon zest, orange peel, light pine, honey, light caramel, biscuit, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, passion fruit, lemon/orange peel, light pine, honey, light caramel, biscuit, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness that lightly increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky, and creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent pale ale. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

COD 12/29/15. Clear amber pour that is slightly darker than golden. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

World class nose that really brings it for an APA. Citrus (orange, tangerine) over a surprising level of dankness with mild pine elements. As it warms, the citric elements come more forward, adding mango and pear.

Light medium body with an almost slick texture fueled by hop oils. Normal carbonation level with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a slightly prickly finish.

The flavor profile is world class - perfectly balanced, quite complex and just the right intensity of flavor and bitterness. The citric flavors of the nose cascade over a dank base. Orange, pear and mango lead as the first wave of biscuit arrives. These shift to tangerine with a bit of rind and a rising dank influence. The middle has a subtle bitterness with both pine and rind aspects which, as they fade, yield the sweetest period for the palate. The finish is a bit dry and slowly fades away leaving a slightly sweet tropical mango and pine aftertaste over a dank background. Alcohol is completely covered and only reveals its presence with a subtle burn at the back of the throat in this brewing masterpiece.

A Toppling Goliath egy főzetének levadászása az egyik legnagyobb hírértékkel bíró cselekedet volt eddigi sörös pályafutásom során, a márka nevéhez ugyanis a legjobb darabok köthetőek a legtöbb stílus esetén. Nincs ez másképpen az american pale ale kategóriájában sem, s ahogyan annak lennie kell, valóban kiemelkedő italról van szó a maga nemében, arany színe alatt ugyanis lehengerlően telt, mégis üdítő aromák bújnak meg azok minden virágosságával, citrusos jellegével, melyek az ízében egy természetes, letisztult, gazdag és kiegyensúlyozott szerkezetben találnak magukra. Fűszeres, lime-os jegyek uralkodnak kifogástalan módon egy száraz, mégis telt zamatokkal teli környezetben. Amellett azonban, hogy hiányérzetünk semmi esetre sem lehet, számomra csak annyit nyújt, amennyit egy egykomlós american pale ale nyújtani képes, azt azonban maradéktalanul megteszi.

Pours a clouded amber-golden color with a fluffy big head. After a few minutes, the head collapses to a thick lacing, which is still half a finger broad.

Smells of ripe citrus, together with biscuit malts and a flowery vanilla note. A lemony crispness prevails, producing juicy freshness. A layer of orange rind adds to the citraic richness, pushing its juiciness of the beer, together with a note of resin.

Drinks very soft, while the beer actually has a higher carbonation to it, which gets entirely coated by cream. 

Tastes of white bread malts, juicy lemon and its great softness straight from the beginning. The malts turn sweeter afterwards, while the beers hop profile develops a nice crispness, featuring a flower coated dryness. Finishes with a noteable malt backbone, while the beers sweetness seemingly results from the juicy fruits, orange and citrus. This creating a fantastic, exotic fruit forward finish with a pleasant, malt accompanied dryness, finding its greatness in its balance.

Another hop forward beer, which convinces by its world class mouthfeel and a perfect balance between hops and malts. The hops provide enough punch to stand out from the malts easily, while I find it astonishing that it is possible to create a beer which is that flavorful, while it drinks easy as lemonade. While not being particularly bitter, neither punching my tastebuds, this combines a fantastic fruitiness with well nuanced crisp and bitter characteristics.

Lived up to its hype and is in my opinion better than Zombie Dust. I really need to find more of this must buy beer.

Pours copper orange with a medium white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: mango, tangerines, citrus, crisp malt, herbal hops, coriander, spices, pine bitterness, tropical fruit, caramel, leaves, herbs, grass, floral and slight peppercorn. TASTE: pine bitterness, coriander, citrus, mango, spices, leaves, herbs, tropical fruit, hop oil spices/acidity, caramel, grass bitterness, crisp malt, tangerines, lime zest, pine bitterness and light peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: citrus, pineapple, spices and crisp malt with an oily spiced finish.

Pours a golden yellow with an off-White head. The smell is a huge citrus , grapefruit nose. The taste is toasted malt, lotta grapefruit and citrus, very concentrated flavour with bitterness on the end. Light+ body with average and prickly carbonation. On another somewhat related subject , Trump is a jackass...
Bottled Oct 2.  Clear gold color with a medium head. Very atrong mango, pineapple, and orange aroma. Moderate bitterness. Light caramel flavor. A bit of dank character. Thin body.

Bottle procured by Falco242. Pungent hop aroma like sticking your nose near a bag of hops. Hazy dark gold; thin ring of head. Incredibly well balanced. This is like a session IPA without the thinness. Not overly carbonated. I can understand the hype to a certain degree. Its truly an impeccable APA. However Im a little surprised beer geeks are going so nuts for a non-big beer. Maybe palates are maturing.

Pours in cloudy golden with a large white head. Aroma; Citrus, mango, grapefrui, apricot and pine notes. Pretty well carbonated with flavours of citrus, pine, grapefruit, apricot with a clear mango and bitter finish! A really nice well balamced beer.

A: Hazy with a huge 3 finger head that stays on for quite a while! Stays iom to the glass as well. N: Grapefruit, mango, cherry(?) hay, pine and barnyard funk. T: Mango, passionfruit, dragonfruit, hay, hint of grapefruit O: I really like this! Tropical fruits and lots of hops. Nice!

Bottle courtesy of Hackobock. Thanks man! 3.5 months old according to the print on the bottle so expectations are rather low. Pours hazy tiny burnt deep yellow with a rather small offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sparse spotty trace on the glass. Smell is fruity and grassy with crackers, white bread, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, lychee, moist grass, pine needles, leek, orange zest and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, tiny bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, star fruit, lychee, prickly pear, moist grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. While its apparent the hops have faded from age this is still a damn good bright hoppy beer. No cardboard oxidation and pretty much the perfect malt base to give the hops room to shine. Basically drinks like bright tropical fruit juice. Hope to try this fresh at some point. I suspect itll blow me away.

Bottle big thanks to richthevillan for my bday present cheers rich you living beer legend!!! Cloudy gold decent head. Aroma citrus grapefruit taste same nice sweet malts good hoppy bitters very good balance long quite dry finish. Nice body mouthfeel slight carbonation. Good allrounder!!

Drank this with my brother while watching Wakefield beat Bradford in the rugby league super league survival game which they won whilst drinking this. Bottle shared with s_hartshorne thanks to richthevillan, thanks very much Rich. Hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma of tropical fruits andcitrus. Taste is citrus, yeast, mango and tropical fruits. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours hazy golden, small white dense head with lacing. Nose has maltiness and a light passionfruit scent, not as strong as expected - Ive had this on tap and it had a much more assertive aroma, not sure why. Flavor is rich malt background, creamy, textured pale barley malt flavors - really good- with a middle and finish that are packed with lightly resiny pine and citrus hop notes. A really nice wash of dank alpha acids lingers extremely long in the finish along with a bit of bitterness.
Hos Johan w. Pigg och citrustoner. Ren och delikat. Hög hinkabilitet. Mycket välgjord. Len och fin beska. Försöker gå igenom förra helgens Sbwf 2015, vilket de flesta av oss var nöjda med.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017 Tons of citrus here, with a blast of stone fruit flavor of orange, apricot and peach, hints of grapefruit, lingering long with crisp, refreshing, lightly spicy hops. Fruit flavors keep pumping. Best pale Ive ever tasted.

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop; hazy golden yellow pour with a frothy white head, aroma has big mango and citrus, smells really fresh, taste spicy mango, big citrus, fresh pine, pink grapefruit, assertive bitter finish, exceptional. Great hop burps from the tumultuous carbs.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare +1. Slightly hazy golden pour with a frothy head. Nose has dank hops, grapefruit, lemon and some apricot. Taste has light resin, grapefruit, pineapple, apricot and light bitterness.

Excellent pale. Plenty of citrus with only a moderate hop bite. Tropical notes on the nose as well. Living in San Diego I rarely trade for hoppy beers but this is one of the exceptions.

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 15/Jun/15. Courtesy of lusikka. 
Slightly hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. 
The aroma is amazing... Tropical fruits all over me... I'm in heaven! The flavor is tropical fruits, mild bitterness, sweetness and general greatness! A truly great APA.

Pours golden color with a small head. Nice citric fruits and grapefruits on the aroma, mango, faint pineapple notes, hops, pine, some floral notes and some faint caramel sweetness. Citric fruity flavor, pale malts, resinous hops and some grass. Not the freshest of bottles but still quite good.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 355 ml bottle. Bottled in June (about 3 months old). Pours a beautiful cloudy yellow colour with a small foamy head. Big, big arroma of huge juicy pineapple, super citrusy hoppiness and some white bread. Flavour of crisp juicy bitterness, pineapple, white bread, pine, mango, a bit of toffee sweetness and white grapes. Light bodied. Super juicy.

355 ml bottle. Same batch, different day. Enjoyed before, during and after sauna. This has to be one of the most juiciest beers Ive ever had. Its not overwhelmingly sweet or malty, and it manages to maintain the drinkability all the way through. This isnt even a fresh batch (well, 3 months old...) and its this good. Wow.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 355ml bottle @ ISKTR, thanks lusikka!
Bottled 15th June, 2015 - 
Pours orange with a small white head. Aroma of juicy citrusy hops, loads of grapefruit, mango, tropical fruits, grassy notes, pine and resin. Taste is smooth, juicy and citrusy with loads of tropical fruits, pine, resin and grass. Finish is hoppy, citrusy and tropical fruity with some bitterness. Pretty tasty and refreshing, even though its not super fresh anymore. 9-4-8-4-16 = 4.1. Re-rated on 24.3.2016. 473ml can from Saveur-Biere. Canned 15/JAN/16. Feels more fresh than the bottled one. Great stuff.

35 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy amber with a little sediment and a white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are peach, tropical fruit, pepper, and flowers - with a bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy light yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is dank, peachy, mango, citrussy, hoppy with some herbal notes in the back. Taste is upfront juicy as fok, tropical, hoppy, citrussy, ripe sweet orange, light pine and herbal notes in the back aswell. Slammable.

Bottle. About 3 month old. Pours hazy orange with an off white head. Aroma of Dank and floral hops, lots of fresh citra, peach, pineapple, orange and mango. The taste is extremely fruity and tropical but has some herbal notes as well as some dank hoppy notes. I would love to try this just a tad fresher - but even now it tastes exceptional good!

12 oz bottle from my Secret Santa, shared at Ale Alpharetta. Light orange color, with a thin, off-white head. Bright, floral, and buttery hops, with some caramel, and resin. Sweet and sugary, with a nice, mellow, bitterness. Medium body, sharp and creamy. This is a solid, well balanced, and wonderfully aromatic beer.

Pours hazy, barely translucent apricot with a nice eggshell head. Hoppy and citrus aroma is more IPA than PA, rather inviting. Bold flavor has a malty core and plenty of resiny hops and citrus tone. Mouthfeel presents good body and firm, persistent fizz. Roaring good in any age.
12 oz bottle pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and malts. Taste is grapefruit and malts.

Aggressive, balls-out hoppiness is a trait I admire in many Pale Ales and IPAs alike, but sometimes, it takes a superbly balanced not-too-boozy and not-too-bitter ale to knock your brain clean out of your skull. No beer has really done that for me like pseudoSue did. The malt foundation is laid out remarkably. It absorbs all but a little of the Citra hops bitterness and lets mango, grapefruit, orange, papaya, and orange cream shine through. Some touches of grass, pine, cannabis, and evergreen as well. Its inconceivable that beer with so little alcohol and IBUs can have as much complexity and deliciousness. Yet, here it is.

(Thanks, Gene! "Travlr")

Bottle.

A- Dank, grassy, evergreen trees, mango, tropical fruits, peach.

T- Mango, papaya, peach, grapefruit, tropical fruits, slightly bitter, grassy, resinous.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, juicy finish.

O- First off, the label is awesome. A dinosaur that somewhat simmers in 
A- Yellow color, hazy liquid, white head.
the light. Just sweet. I love my Citra hops so the fact that this was a single hop beer with Citra I was excited. It didnt fail. So much tropical and stone fruit juiciness, it is unreal. Great beer, and this is coming from a guy who isnt fond of pale ales. I could drink a lot of this.

12oz. bottle from discount liquors Milwaukee. Nose is very piney and resinous , taste is a hop explosion. I had to re-check to make sure this was a pale ale and not a full blown IPA. This was an outstanding pale ale that I would make my default beer if it was sold in my area!

Bottle thanks to Kyle! Pours a near clear light gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of bitter citrus with a bit of resin, a touch of onion and a sweet grain backbone. Flavor starts with sweet citrus with a growing bitter citrus note, light resin and a sweet grain backbone.

Good retention and good lacing. Smells of grapefruit, lemon rind and mango. Tastes of mango, citrus and grapefruit. Perfect bitter aftertaste.
