Bottle. Amber with a nice little head. Aroma is crazy tropical, mango, citrus. Really explosive. Tropical notes dominate the palate, some malty backbone. Dry finish. Really nice
Gift from CC. hazy golden colour with small head. Fresh tropical aroma. Hoppy taste. Nice.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is citra, mango and tropical juice. Flavour is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, slick texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is citris and a mild bitterness.

Cloudy golden color with lots of lace. Aroma of passion fruit and a little cat urine and some mango. Medium bodied. Taste is super juicy with a dry finish. Lots of passion fruit and mango. Man is this juicy, just exploding with tropical fruit. A damn fine beer.

Dégustée chez Janick en compagnie de Luc, Marc-André, Stéphane et Roger. Merci à Luc pour le partage! Bière plutôt pâle, mousseuse et agréable à regarder. Le tout se tient à merveille et est très appétissant. Beaucoup de houblons frais au nez, de lagrume légère et tropicale. Les arômes sont fraîches, délicates et raffinées. En bouche jai été quelque peu déçu par les saveurs qui soffraient à moi. Bouquet unidimensionnel, un peu mince et complètement dominé par une saveur de pain frais et de farine de blé. Vraiment, on est sur le grain contrairement à mes attentes. Le houblon anticipé est retenu ou éclipsé et ne reste de lui quune fine amertume en errière-goût. Je ne mattendais absolument pas à cela de cette bière. Je devrai y goûter à nouveau cest certain.

At first taste I think what the fuck is the big deal? Nice citrus and a bit of grapefruit. But then it starts warming a bit and the taste explosion kicks in. Layers add with tropical fruits especially pinapple, then mango, then dank weed, then a nice hop bitterness. Citra hops rock.

Brewed in Florida and bottled in June, thanks to sarro for the trade. Hazy yellow/golden with a medium sized white head with good retention and lace. Juicy hoppy nose with lots of citrus and sweet tropical fruits; persimmon, peach, mango, apricot. Same goes for flavour where the citrus dominates but still has all the tropical stuff in the back with some light bready malts. Medium body, fine soft carbonation, filling sweetness, balanced bitterness. Really nice. One of the best APAs I have tried.

Bottle dated July 10. My first Sue. Pour is a cloudy Amber with aromas of citrus and grass. Medium bodied, malt balanced with citrusy hops aplenty. Very tasty and refreshing. I would however, like to try a super fresh Sue or one on draft.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 Cloudy copper with a thick off-white head. Very thick lacing. The aroma is juicy citrus, with some resinous pine. Fruity flavor with some strong pineapple and grapefruit. Nice malt in there that leaves a bready malt finish. Not overly bitter and very nice.
Bottle at home. Pours cloudy almost amber. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus and grassy. Juicy! Taste us quite bitter with a light malty backbone. Medium bodied and pretty crust. Excellent

Bottle, thanks to Mary and Craig, shared at Ebeneezers Tent Town bottle share. Really good usage of Citra. Nicely dry-hopped. Super clean. Juicy grapefruit and mango. A liquid form of dried mangoes. I enjoyed this. This one was from the new contracted place.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 12oz bottle from my landlord. Poured clear amber orange with min white head. Aroma of piney citrus. Light carb med bod. Taste light bitter good malt dank hop.
Bottle. Copper gold color with a white head. Grapefruit aroma and flavor. Very good.
Really nice APA. Tons of fresh citrus, especially grapefruit in the aroma and flavor of the beer. Tried at the Craft beer tent at the Iowa State Fair.

Hazy golden orange pour with a thin white head and light sticky lacing .... Aroma of citra hops for sure! Nice mango, orange and grapefruit notes .... Taste is of grapefruits, mango and orange also has nice pine notes with a light caramel malt backbone .... Has a light bitter hop bite to it .... Soft mouthfeel ..... Bitterness is a bit more lively in the dry hopped finish .... Incredibly sessionable brew

Two 12 oz bottles, purchased and tasted several days apart. Bottled dates of 10 Jul 15 and 10 Aug 15. Poured into an Irish Imperial pint glass. Golden color, hazy. Moderate amount of visible carbonation. 1/2 inch of slightly off-white head that recedes slowly, leaving some lacing on the glass. Aroma is wonderful citrus and pine. Pleasant, inviting me to take a taste. Good initial body and mouth feel. Malt backbone is present, but so are the hops. Definite citrus "juiciness", but the dominant hops taste is pine that carries through the middle, with the bitterness asserting in the finish. Very well balanced, though, with the malty body continuing through to nicely balance the hops bitterness and to finish clean. This ale is really good. Theres been a lot of discussion that the Brew Hub / FL versions are substandard compared with the legendary Decorah brew, but these versions are really good.

Bottle at the RateBeer WWWW Tasting shared by Travlr, thanks! Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, floral. Tastes of citrus, floral, pine, tropical fruit. Medium body with a dry finish. Great pale.
Tha gangstaz hook a brother up with this. Great hopz on the top. Hazy golden pour. Fruity and bitter and real. Citrus and hay. Good stuff. Bottle shared by Travlr.
Solid pale ale. Not over the top, highlights the hop nicely. Good grapefruit and citrus notes.
Finally in minnesota!....wait was way worth it...fantastic pale ale.....so smooth...balance is perfect...fantastic finish....the best pale ale i have ever tried...wow!
Holy Citra hops! Aroma of pineapple, grass and citrus. Orange Amber color with white head. Taste is a juicy citrusy mango explosion of fruit. Bitter yet fruity finish. Awesome.

Bottle shared by Keith, pours a slightly ugly murky brown gold with white head. Aroma of skunk malt and pine cheese funk. Flavor of beef jerky, honey, tea, peach and cheesy citra. Weird smokey meat quality. Bottle was 4 weeks old but it shouldnt be this bad. Medium body.

Wow, the hype is real. Burnt orange pour with slight head and lacing. Big tropical fruit aromas and flavors- mango, pineapple, grapefruit along with some pine which greats a bit of a bit at the finish. Very solid pale ale.

Pours a pale gold with a goodly amount of foam that leaves some lacing behind.

Huge citrus on the nose with almost as big aromas of mango. Smells hoppier vs bitter.

The citrus just kicks it here. Mixed in with that mango and a light malt that comes across as bready, this is one magnificent APA. Btw, the citrus is most definitely grapefruit with a touch of lemon zest.

Medium bodied, perfect carbonation.

So flavourful, so refreshing, so damn good. Hell yeah!
Bottle. Orange-mango malt and grassy grapefruit peel aroma. Hazy golden yellow with nice head. Sweet orange/peach, malt, and moderately bitter grapefruit peel/pine flavor. Nice body.

Merci à tom10101 pour la dégustation. Belle robe orangée avec mousse assortie. Au nez, conifères, herbes folles, fruits exotiques, agrumes, épices, oranges et céréales minimalement douces. Au goût, un jus doranges et de fruits exotiques avec des saveurs de pin et de résine. En bouche, un corps moyen-fable avec un pétillement normal et une texture légèrement huileuse. Une finale amère, longue, pleine de pamplemousse, de fleurs et de bonne résine. Très facile à boire. Bien parfumée, savoureuse. Une belle réussite.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle from shrubber82, May 28, 2015, poured into an English pint glass. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is herbal hops, medium carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is some grapefruit, herbal hops, and slightly bitter finish. Very good pale ale.
Citra bomb...Smells great, tastes great. Juicy orange and tropical fruits abound. Eminently smashable.
Excellent orange cream flavour. Lacy. Malting very good. Good mouthfeel.great hoppy beer.

Bottle. Pale tangerine hue with soft haze and a frothy cap of white. Aroma delivers grass, orange peel and lime in front of soft honey and a touch of sweet mango. Clean, admittedly complex citrus pith leads the flavor and is backed up by a perfect crackery sweetness that carries the brew to a clean, balanced finish. This was bottled at the end of May and, if other reviews are any indication, has dropped off dramatically in two months. Its obviously a very well-made beer, but lacking in hop brightness and complexity.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 22oz bottle thanks to Steve. Pours out a hazy straw topped with a white head. Nose is pine citrus rich malty sweetness and a nice grapefruit. Taste is more of the sweetness caramel grapefruit pithy notes and some spice.

Bottle:
Pours hazy, yellow/gold with a thick, off=white head.
Grapefruit-peel and sweet pine aroma.
Flavours of mango, grapefruit, orange.....
Peppery, citrus and peel bittering.
Nicely malted, very smooth and extremely tasty....Excellent Stuff!!!

Bottle shared with Luk. Creamsicle orange juice pour, very cloudy orangey pour with thick creamy white head. Aroma is intensely hoppy, nice dankness, light piney notes, very resinous and fruity hop aroma, tons of orange zest, light grapefruit. Taste is bitter but not aggressively so, nice juicy hop flavor, full hop flavor intensity without much bitterness. Palate is med bodied, nice creamy texture. Dangerously easy to drink, delicious.

Thanks a million to tom1010 for finding us that bottle! It pours a hazy golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of oranges and weed. Taste is juicy fruits and moderately bitter. Flavors of mangoes and weed again. Incredibly good. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and the extreme juiciness make it extremely easy to drink. Just plain awesome, really. I want more!

pours hazy/cloudy pale golden with a small creamy white cap, good retention and lacing. tons of mangoes, citrus - fresh limes, lean maltiness, pineapple, basil, thyme, spices,, clean yeast action. light carbonation, light body - oily; balanced very fruity-mango-citrusy finish. speechlessly incredible. really.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours hazy orange with medium-high white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, fruits, resin. Taste is of citrus, fruits, bitterness, tropical fruits, some alcohol, resin. Palate: Medium body. Medium-high carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Crafty citra.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Bottle (22 oz). Split 2-ways with Minderbinder. Thanks to tbadiuk for the bottle. A few weeks old, I dont see a bottling date. 

Appearance: Cloudy orangey-golden with some particles floating, a medium easy to revive creamy off-white head, good retention and good lacing. 

Aroma: Nice tropical features, light resin, grass, cereals, caramel (but not in a bad way) and floral hops. 

Taste: Not much sweetness despite a pretty good malt backbone. Tropical fruits, crisp cereals, grass, biscuity notes, caramel and moderate bitterness.

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Fluffy mouthfeel. Crisp and clean. Rather dry finish. 

Overall: An extremely well balanced pale with one of the best malt backbone Ive had in a Pale Ale so far. Easy drinkable. Alcohol is well hidden/integrated. Tasty stuff. Not on Trillium level though.

EDIT: Drank a 2nd bottle all by myself and I need to update aroma + overall of 1 pt each. Much more aromatic. Lighter in color.

Served on tap at Toppling Goliath. Golden color with a light white head. Citrus and hops aroma. Medium body carbonated texture. Hoppy citrus mango flavor. Nice balance without the hoppy bite.

Solid and bright golden, decent white crowned head. Greasy, grassy and full on pith party; dank enough. Initial taste is upped on the pith front, tangerine, clean sherbertty fuzz without being overly carbonated. Mouthfeel is fairly solid and this is suprisingly underbitter and softly sweet. Grapefruit party kicks on here, bit of a tropical cocktail sweetness comes through but just kicks things into touch before it gets anything but more delicious. Finishes much the same and the linger is fairly dry and more sherbetty pale pale malt. Bottle, Beers I Hadnt Known Were Gushers Daisy Tasting
Pours a clear golden yellow with moderate white head which soon recedes. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus orange, pine and spruce. Taste is citrus, weak pine, moderate bitterness.
Bottle thanks to Craig. Golden with white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, pineapple. Taste follows suit, all hops, pineapple and mango. Dry and delicious

bottle at home ... daisy tasting ... golden amber .. thin white lacing ... soft passion ... zezty fruit ... juicy floral fruits ... soft floral fruits ... juicy hop .. peppery zezty fruits ... big zezty fruit .. long soft passion .. juicy fruits
Bottle at Craigs tasting, big thanks Craighoppy citrus and passion fruit, light bodied, clean,fresh, melon.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear golden, nose is floral, citrus, toffee, taste is dry toffee, sweet fruit.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Aromas of mandarin oranges, grassy, tropical fruits. Taste is bitter oranges, pith. Bitter finish. Good stuff.

12th July, gusher tasting
I love this pale ale. It is just hoppy enough to distinguish itself from many pale ales, but its greatest attribute for me is the complex citrus palate. Fantastic!

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 Pours hazy amber with a frothy head. Aroma is crazy complex; mango, citrus, sweet tropical fruits, resin, and pine. Aroma-wise this is basically perfect, absolutely begging to be tasted. Big, sweet, in-your-face citrus balanced by the piney resin notes of the hops and the smooth malts. Delicious. Cannot recommend enough. Edit: this review was of the 22 oz bomber produced in Decorah, not the FL-based four pack of cans.

Hazed yellow gold. Creamy head at first. Blazing juicy aroma, tropical, citrus.Dry toast caramel.Sweetness. Same In taste, juicy, kinda on the sweet side. Sweet hops possibly. Lemon. mango- and first time Ive ever noticed mango so noticeable. Dry toast caramel light, grassy lemon bitter, tart finish but balanced with sweet. bottle about a week old I belive, nice. Good pale ale great hop vibrancy and freshness, solid, yet I dont think its one of my top 10 pale ales.

Bottle shared by My friend Eric at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours dark golden with a nice white head and a magnificent citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a lot of grapefruit and a mellow pine finish. Nicely crafted

Bottle from sister-in-laws boyfriend. Nose is juicy citrus and tropical fruit. Huge hop aroma. Flavor is full on citrus with a light malt bite to even it out. Pale ale? Maybe thats what they call it. More like an IPA, but who knows or cares now a days. Its a damn fine brew.
Great taste, wonderful aroma, A deep orange color. It is a great summer beer.

Tap at brewery. Hazed golden pour. Great nose of tropical fruits. Tastes of honey dew, peach, mango, earthy hops, resin, and grass. Smooth easy drinking palate. Listed as 5.8 from brewery. Really delicious.
Really nice orange color on this and massive hop aroma. Overall a pretty well balanced, yet hoppy, delicious pale.
[5/3/15] Draught after Mikkeller Beer Run in Copenhagen. Lovely green fruity hops aroma. Flavor of juicy fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Really good,.
Big, blasting citrus aroma is out of the bottle even before the pour begins. But the taste and aftertaste are remarkably light, attributable to its 50 IBU. Great summer beer.
Pours a hazy orange / Amber with white head. Massive hop aroma and flavor. Well Balanced

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy orange / Amber with a nice bubbly head. Aroma is citrus, mango, tropical fruit, faint caramel malts. Taste is nice citrusy and tropical hops, a faint acidity / salinity. Pine notes on the back end. Mild honey sweetness, a bit of toast. Moderately bitter, balanced and clean on the palate. Great pale ale.
Good beer, but not as balanced as I would expect. Bitterness dominated and i felt that hop flavor/aroma was lacking

Draught. Almost clear golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, fresh hops, bread, grain and light mango. Probably a bit old. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of fresh hops, bread and citrus. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice but probably old.

Pours hazy amber with low white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, grapefruit and passion fruit. Taste is light resin bitter with mango sweet finish. Light smooth body with soft carbonation. Perfect drink after the Mikkeller beer run!
From a bottle into a glass. The pour is a cloudy yellow above average c02 with a white head. This beer taste like juicy mangoes and hops.

Again EricTeusink hooking up the dope IPAs for this tasting. And this was one of the best ive had. Pine and citrus in the nose. Juicy citrus fruits and apricot and mango with touches of pine in the taste. Good body. Real nice.

Bottle from trade. Pours turbid, murky orange, with a thin head - its an ugly beer. Aroma is great though, straight-up fresh mango with some ripe peach in there too. Medium carbonation, full and oily mouthfeel, very drinkable. Rich, sweet mango, a pronounced malty sweetness but enough hop presence to make the sweetness fruity and feel like drinking pure juice. Apricot, mango, peach flavours throughout. Bitterness is proportionate. An excellent beer that recalls - but doesnt quite beat - Kernel Citra.

22oz bomber from some pretty cool neckbeards drank on Easter. Poured a an almost milky looking orange body with an average sized dense foamy bright white head. Aroma is juicy citrus fruits, dry toast, touch of honey sweetness, citrus and tropical fruit rinds. Medium to fuller body, average carbonation and an aftertaste that starts dry but a subtle sweetness lingers. Flavor mimics the aroma. Really nice pale ale.
Aroma is intense. Tropical and fruity. Really entertaining. Flavor is solid as well. Good balance a little more pine on the flavor. Awesome.

Pours orange-gold with a small white head. Aroma is mango and tangerines - maybe a little grapefruit. Taste is all of the above right upfront followed by beautiful grainy malts that start making their appearance in the mid. All is perfectly balanced with an easy bitterness all the way to the finish. Awesome! Blend midwestern wheatfields with the tropics and you should get this APA.

Strong aromatics! Peaches, melons, some mint, lychee. Zesty. Minty and tropical on the tongue. Incredibly soft on the palate with a juicy hop attack that leaves fruit on the palate. Not a hop onslaught, just tons of hop flavor.

Super refreshing. Citra hops all the way!
Love it! Best pale ale I have had.

Fresh bottle. Clear, bright yellow pour with moderate amount of foamy head. Good retention. Big floral/citrus/woody aroma. Really vibrant. Taste is amazing - orange, grapefruit, lemon peel, resiny. This was gulpable. I want mas!

Draft and bottle. Its hard to believe this is "only" a pale ale. Pours a cloudy orange with a large frothy head. Nose is overwhelming tropical fruits and pineapple. Taste is equally as great. World class.

Draft at Hunaphu Day 2014. Light golden pour with a bubbly white head. Big juicy tropical fruit hop nose with mild pine bitterness. Flavor is similar, bright, juicy and refreshing. Dry bitter finish and delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Wow one of the brightset, tricked out pales ever. Nice citrus nose, but the mouthfeel is amazing. Light bready, peach, pineapple, toffee malt and a sweetness that dries up nicely. Light and well carbed. Excellent drinker. Put this on tap and park the bus! UPDATE Damn cans is tasty. Nice.

Light amber golden color. Frothy white head. Huge Citra bomb in the nose with lots of mango and citrus notes. The mouth is flawless, really well hopped, decent backbone, but light and smooth. Uber quaffable. Modest, but not aggressive bitter finish. Very rounded. A benchmark of an APA. Lives up to the hype.

Tasted from a growler (thanks Pablo). It poured a hazy golden amber with a frothy white head and spotty lacing. Bodacious bouquet of mixed citrus and mango. Bright flavors with refreshing burst of hops. Toppling Goliaths got a winner here!

ShaDamn, Rockem Sockem to me Robots this beer Fn Rocks!!!
Niue takes a great bite out of you, the citra, grapefruit, mild IPA finish is a killer.DRINK THIS BEER

Growler thanks to the one and only Jstax ! Pours a medium golden color with two fingers of sticky eggshell foam. Nose is a big burst of citrus, valencia orange some sweet tropical fruits and a hint of scallion and sticky pine. Palate follow with a big juicy hop profile lots of sweet tropical fruit bordering on sticky but the bitter orange peel and grass notes clean up the finish nicely !
22oz bomber pours a cloudy orange with an off white head. Tropical fruit taste. Big mango and citrus taste

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Sample at CBC 2014, and bottle at Mikkeller Bar a couple of days after.  Pours clear amber with a tan head. Aroma of massive citrus hops, with light grassy aspects and tropical fruit, balancing perfectly against a soft caramel malt backbone.   Flavour is moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.  Excellent!
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2014 Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow. Plenty of citrus fruit to go around, in the nose and in the mouth. Taste is very smooth and full of light hop goodness. Plenty of mango .

Sample @ CBC 14, thnx to random stranger. Pours a clear golden beer with a small white head on top. Aroma of tropical fruits, grapefruit, pineapple. Flavor is moderately bitter, fruity and very defect for an IPA. Does not really live up to the hype.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 Poured from a bomber given to us at DLD. Quite unexpected.
Dark orange with a white head
Aroma is sweet hoppy. 
Flavor is grapefruit perfection with pineapple. Seems to even have a ever so slight cucumber hiding there in the finish. WOW-o-WOW
Balanced well to the palate. Well done!!

Hot damn thats good. Golden pour light white head. Grapefruit citrus aroma and hay. Tons of grapefruit, fruit bowl fresh melon in a light body and perfect carbonation. Loved this one. Citra hops please.
Pre-DLD bottle share at Hampton Inn. Pour is golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma and flavor of huge citrus, light pine, hay, and mango. Finish is lingering fruit and hop bitterness.

Shared in line while waiting for King Sue. Really cool to be able to try these back to back. Aromas of grapefruit, mango, pinapple, pine. Light bitterness and easy drinking. Very balanced. Simply delicious.

22oz bomber courtesy of TheHOFF43. It pours with a beautiful hop hazed deep gold body that supports a dirty white head of foam. The aroma offers up juicy tangelo and clementine citrus hop notes as well as a good dose of mango. A very inviting aroma. The taste is rich and vibrant with tangelo and clementine and mango where there is a refreshing crisp and snappy feel to it. The backbone is clean and crisp and very light but just enough to hold this together. Wow! Love this

Bomber. Pours cloudy orange golden with a good lacing head. Aroma is an explosion of tropical fruits pines citrus fruits hoppy resin...lovely. Flavor is similar, very smooth drinking lots of flavors and nicell bitter but not too heavily. Good longlived bitter fruity fresh aftertaste.

Bottle thanks to Bob! &nbsp Fresh Pale Ale, flavorful without being bitter. &nbsp Ctirus peel and pith are the main bits. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Strong citrusy notes on the finish, Not too sweet, not all that bitter either, but very flavorful. &nbsp A very good Pale Ale but it doesnt capture me as some others do. &nbsp Pretty tasty!

Gold beer with a sticky white head. Big, fresh tropical fruit and hop candy nose. This is a juicy beer. Tons of citrus, mango, Mandarin orange, and hop Jolly Ranchers flavors, with enough malts to balance it out. Very fresh tasting hoppy beer.

Draft serving at the source. Pours a hazy orange with a white head of foam. The aroma has big citrus and pine. The taste is sweet initially, but starts to dry out in the finish. Light to medium body with medium carbonation.

Bottle (thanks to Ibrew1or2). Pineapple and mango highlight an awesome, clean aroma with rich pine resin, a touch of cat urine, and dry hay. Light straw in color with a thin swirl of a head. Crisp taste of bitter lemon peel, grapefruit, a light wood tone, and a resiny bite at the end. Light body with a super-dry finish. Refreshing as heck!

Hazy orange pour, white head, great lacing. Nose is big onion, citrus, very fresh. Taste is onion, light mango, biscuit, lasting light bitter finish. Soft carbonation, a touch watery but for the style the mouthfeel is still great. I could drink this all day.

Bottle acquired via trade with ReeceG! Damn! Damn! This one is world-class! Murky 14 karat brew with a dense ivory crown that leaves delicate rings of lacing inside the glass. One word: Intense! Dank, biting citrus, enamel peeling acidity, earthy grassiness, grapefruit pith, orange peel, lemon peel, papaya, guava, mango, and a touch of leafy greens. Incredibly complex. So many flavors and complimentary aromas. A liquid gem!

Lightly hazy, orange color, and a quick-fading white head. Ripe aroma of peach, mango, orange, and grapefruit. Mild sweetness in the front and citrus peel bitterness in the back. Lively and crisp, almost light-bodied, and a clean finish.
Kat whizzy aroma. Misty light gold. Tastes a lot smoother than it smells. Not all that bitter v. the aroma. Lightly sweet. Lightish body. Thanks to some masked Ratebeerian downstairs at Proof.

Bomber poured into a Dogfish Head IPA glass

Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick head. The aroma is total citrus, grapefruit? Still waiting for the head to dissipate. Lots of tiny bubbles. This maybe my first APA so Im not sure of what it is suppose to taste like. Hoppy, I could see how it might be a relative of a IPA. Strange citrus flavor. I am not a big grapefruit fan so this might not be a beer for me. I will admit though, I have never had a beer that tastes anything like this and the aroma hits me in the nose every time I take a drink. I will give it a chance to grow on me since I have 3 more bottles left.
Nice pale Yellow and hazy pour with an nice hoppy aroma and good earthy and citrus hops. Awesome pale ale.
Pours a hazy orange color with formal notes on the nose. Nice bitterness in the flavor with hints of mango and citrus. Beautiful balanced finish.
Whoa. How is that a pale ale? That smells like and tastes like an IPA. Whoa. That is SO good. Wow. Unreal.

From the April 2014 3R6P gathering. +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy yellow-gold color with a small foamy white head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was dry, bitter, citric and had a bit of grapefruit. The flavor was bitter, tart and tangy with notes of lemon, grapefruit, a bit of chalk and Sweettart candies. Medium length finish of lemon and chalk. Medium body. Ok.
Simply the best. Very clean and crisp. Malts really let those citrus flavored citra hop shine. I have yet to have a better APA. And I have been trying pretty hard.

A: Cloudy golden orange, really creamy head that lingers.

S: Wow looooovvee Citra hops, and this showcases why. Candied mango, grapefruit, passion-fruit, some lemon/lime, tangerine, and light pine. Very tropical. Smells like HF Citra Single, although more pungent. 

T: Upfront I get a watermelon like vegetable taste. Not as flavorful as the aroma would suggest, maybe some light citrus notes. Cant get over the overwhelming watermelon taste. 

M: Crisp with a light sweetness, appealing dryness as well.

O: Not sure if its the bottle I got or this is actually how it is but after smelling this beer I was let down. The aroma is just so amazing but didnt drink as well as the smell, was kinda let down on the hype.

Bottle: Poured a hazy orange color ale with a large foamy head with excellent retention and some great lacing. Aroma consists of tropical fruits with light citrus notes with great floral notes. Taste is also dominated by huge fresh tropical fruits notes with light citrus notes and some very limited bitterness. Some residual sugar is perceptible with light malt presence. Body is full for style with good carbonation. This is a world-class pale ale for sure.

Bomber from Historic Casanova Liquors in Hudson, WI. Massive catty Citra nose, tropical fruit, banana, celery, and ripe melon. Large grapefruit, thick solid caramel cut through with the hops, and tongue-buzzing grain. Finishes more or less balanced -- but still bursting with flavors. This is a pale ale taken to a new dimension. One hell of a tasty brew.
Bomber. Big, juicy nose, tropical fruits, orange, mango, passion fruit. Cloudy orange color. Stinky mango, orange, peach, flavors, sweet and crackers full and smooth. Wow. Magnificent.

Pours a murky golden color, way less bright than I would expect from a beer of this style. Aroma is pleasant and obviously citra hops - passion fruit & citrus. Taste is where this beer loses me (and I know I am in the minority), but I find this beer to have a rather unpleasant bitterness that I associate with using citra as a bittering hop. Tastes more like cat piss (in a bad way) than the wonderful flavors citra hops put out when used later on in the boil. Those great flavors are still present, but are masked by a front end bitterness/bad taste that I could not get past. Ive had citra hop homebrews that I enjoyed more than this beer, sad to say.

Pours hazy orange, with a nicely looking 1-fingered frothy white head. Aroma of peach, mango orange. What follows all these fruity notes is something "green" - like green banana peel or cucumber peel? Slightly random imo.
The taste is slightly sweet up front, with light bitterness. Well balanced. Semi full bodied, with a medium carbonation. 
Thanks a bunch to Mr. Dunt for sending me this.

This was a 7% bottle. Have had psuedoSue several times, but this batch was unreal! Pours a hazy golden orange. Two-finger white head, lasts for a good while before forming a nice little cap. Aromas of HUGE peaches, light mango, cat piss, light malted sweetness and some pine. Taste follows the nose with wonderful tropical fruits upfront. Peaches, tangerine, mango, slight grapefruit tang and then the pine and skunky finish. A medium mouthfeel gives this one some balance to the big flavors. Moderate bitterness gives sue a defined finish and leaves my mouth watering for me. Such a big fan of this beer.
Bottle share thanks to Homer. Aroma of pine, hops, earth.taste is smooth, hoppy, a bit of dirt. Tasty.

Bottle. Cloudy burnt orange pour with a white head. Grapefruit hop aromas. Crisp, clean, and dry with pleasant hoppy bitterness. Grapefruit notes dominate with just enough of a malt backbone to keep the ale honest. Citrus and dank pine undercurrents. A nice easy drinking pale ale. Another solid beer from TG.

Bottle pours slightly hazy orange with white head. Very nice aroma of orange and citrus. Sweet malty taste quickly followed by orange and citrus. palate fairly full, just right for the style. Finish a little grapefruit-like dull bitterness. No discernible alcohol.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 *Recent batches havent been the same. Still one of the better APAs out there, but no longer in a class of its own.

Thanks to reeceg for the trade of this. Absolutely amazing beer. The aroma was very fruity and I could smell and taste the grapefuit. This was the 7% version and it went down very smooth. Beautiful appearance and left some nice lacing all down the glass as I drank. Taste was superb! I was left wanting more after I finished this and its a must try for any fan of APA.

Fresh 22 oz bottle at 7%. Misty orange with a white head. Nose is preserved lemon, toffee and marjoram. Oily with a fluffy mouthfeel finishing with tiny carb prickles. Taste is tangerine, spruce, citrus honey and peel. Big for a Pale ale with a creative take on the style. Id put this just behind Walden (a session IPA now?) and the King.

Bottle at Toppling Goliath tent at Hunahpus Day 2014. Pours an orangey gold with a fair amount of white head. Head held pretty well, and there was a medium collar, not much lacing. Aroma and taste were citrusy and lightly tropical. I honestly drank this so quick I couldnt get a fair assessment. By the time I went back for another pour, it was already out. Surprisingly light and refreshing mouthfeel, slight bitter bite.
Poured from a bottle at a rb tasting it is an effervescent clear golden color with a white head. The aroma is citrus and the taste is grapefriut taste that lingers on the palate.
Thanks to Iphonephan! Poured a nice clear orange color with a small white head, some lacing. Aroma is nice citrus, orange zest, crisp notes. Flavor is incredibly fresh tasting citrus notes.
From a bottle at the RB tasting on Sunday in McLean. Pours a clear gold. Fruity hop nose. Flavors of citrus and pine. Smooth, clean finish.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 Another reminder, for me, that Citra isnt my thing even if its a pretty damn impressive hop in the right recipe. Aroma is juicy melony/mango, flavor is extremely straightforward melon juice which isnt the worst thing in the world but doesnt offer the flavors I love in a Pliny or Duet. Really well-made beer, but not something I find incredibly drinkable due to the straightforward flavor profile.

Tried again.  Much more into this thing than before.
(4 Hands Lupulin Festival) orange gold. Citrus aroma. Flavor was citrus, tropical fruit, some malt.
im not an IPA person at all, but i can appreciate the appeal of this. really good for what it is. just not for me.

Bottle thanks to Wrye, damn, thanks again! Pours a nice and clear deep golden with light white head. Aroma is peach and mango for a mile with a slight resinous citra hop character. Taste is mango puree through and through. Wow. Pale ale?! The peach really opens up and a nice bitter hop character emerges as the beer warms. Not sure why I let it warm in the least. This beer is hands down the best APA Ive ever had. Zombie Dust? PFFF! The Midwest has definitely cornered the marked on APAs it seems.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
UPDATED: MAR 6, 2014 Bottle share with Kraddel. Both the 5,8% and 7%. The 7% is less cloudy. Aroma of the 5,8% is more fruity, mango, passion fruit, kiwi. 7% is more intense and bitter and aroma lasts longer. Taste of the 5,8% is fruity mango, kiwi and passion fruit Light to medium bitterness. The 7% tastes less fruity, more bitterness. 5,8% is my favourite. 
Shame the 7% is an alias because Id give it a lower rating. The given rating is for the 5,8%.   
Rating for the 7% would be : Ar 7/10, A: 5/5, Taste 7/10, Palate: 4/5, Overall 15/20.

Bottle VS Bottle ( 5,8 next to the 7 ABV ) Thnx to steasy66 ! split bought and tasted with ST247

Both pour blonde. 7 ABV is really clear, 5,8 is bit more fuzzy
Both have good white foam . 

Scent ; The 7 ABv is bit more bitter, where the 5,8 is more fruity , and much faster gone . 

Taste : 5,8 is PURE kiwi, fleshy kiwi even . Mango, ... A real fruitpunch ! If I ate more fruit, i would probably be able to name many more, this thing is a BOMB . Tiny hints of bitterness . Maybe even a bit TOO fruity for my taste . 

7 has more body. As expected bit more bitter, fruityness is more in balance . Still a tastebomb , but way more in balance . 

Both are very mango-based, and taste like pure mango-juice . Prob could use more complexity , to be real perfection .

Poured from a 22 ounce bottle, big thanks to Charles for bringing this in to share!! Hazy golden pour, lively head. Nose and flavor are absolutely gorgeous, with huge pink grapefruit, bright lemon zest, blood orange, scallion, garlic, peach, pine, and hints of tropical fruit. Complex and divine, full on the mouthfeel, and at 7% definitely an IPA and not an APA. Still, absolutely fantastic.
Pours an almost see through golden Orange with a quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is all citra. Nice mouthful. A great beer

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Pours a rich golden ale with a minimal head. Lovely citrus nose leads to a sweet palate filled with hints of mango and passion fruit. Citra hops really pump this pale up and make it original and distinct.

Big thanks to DocJ007 for sharing this one at last nights tasting, my first Toppling Goliath beer.


A - Pours slightly hazy orange with a nice one finger tall white head, quickly dissipating down to a light film, leaving sticky webs of lace down the sides of the glass.


S - Smells of bright citra hops, light caramel sweetness, fresh cut grass and strong fresh zested citric fruit. Much like Zombie Dust this one is all about the citric fruit.


T - Starts off with the dynamic duo of strong citra hop bitterness and fresh tropical fruitiness slowly being joined by the grassiness and some mild caramel sweetness. Finish is bitter with a bit of light sweetness, lingering for a little while after the finish.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Crisp, bitter feel from start to finish. Very easy to consume, even with the added ABV.


O - A really nice easy drinking APA. It has everything I love in these hopped up APAs. I would say this is in my top 3 along with Zombie Dust and Edward. I would love to have this on a regular basis.

Bottle @ home. Thanks, Andy. Amber pour with a dense khaki head. Smells of tea, tart grapefruit, lemon peel, and orange rind. Sweet caramel, feet, and a bit of pine. A bit sweet on the front end of the taste. Lots of caramel, orange, and plenty of grapefruit. Light lemon and tea. Big dank, resinous, pine notes.
Very fruity and citrus like with a slight bitter bite and very easy to drink and enjoy, a must order/buy if available

Shared bomber to snifter. Dark yellow orange pour with light carbonation. Sweet malt and grapefruit aroma. Taste is very juicy tropical fruits with just a little hop bite. Not a hop head by any measure but this is very smooth and fruity.

Month old bottle generously shared by Dave. Aroma is green tea, and tropical fruits. Pours light blonde and hazy with a small head. Taste is amazing! Kiwi fruit, green tea, lemon, honeydew, and nectarine. Mouthfeel is juicy but intense. No bitter aftertaste. Just a perfect blend of some unique hoppy flavors. Very cool! Would love to get this on tap.
Really amazing aroma - sweet and fruity. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Great fruity/citrus flavor with a mild hop bitterness

22 oz bottle. Minneapolis. 

Pours nice golden color with small white head. Mostly clear. 

Aroma: Fruits - passion fruit, pineapple. Citrus, hops. 

Taste, Sweet with a small amount of bitterness int he finish. 

Palate: Medium body. long finish. 

Really nice beer.
Crisp golden pour with a ctream head. Nose is big tropical fruits, juicy malts, mango, delicious. Great palate, huge mango, fresh hops, nice and smooth malt backbone.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2015 Aroma is strong orange/citrus with fruit in the background. The flavor is orange/citrus, Capri-Sun/fruit drink, light hop resin, a background of malts and a very dry/mildly bitter finish.  The last time I had this it was a lot like a lower abv IPA without any concessions, basically what every Session IPA wishes to be.

Hazy gold. Bright citrusy floral aroma. Taste is the same...big floral hop notes combined with fruity citrus flavors. Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle) Pours a semi-hazy orange color with a medium white head that lingers. Initial smells reveal a predominant scent of orange and mango. This is by far one of the most forward-smelling mango beers Ive tried. Further warming elicits pineapple/banana/orange juice.  Even further warming yields some mint and Evening in Missoula tea. Wild stuff. Flavor is really nice, with an initial citrus explosion of grapefruit, orange, lychee fruit, and mango. The mango really lingers on into the finish, and I can still get tastes of it while exhaling. The usual suspects of pretzely/crackery malt or stinging bitter hops are absent, and the main aspect of the flavor is an even fruitiness from start to finish. With some warming a bit of the malt character peeks through, but it certainly plays second fiddle to the hoppiness. Mouthfeel is medium with a little heft, and the carbonation is spot on. This has to be one of, if not the, best pale ale(s) Ive ever had. Nice job, TG, Ill certainly be buying this again.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 65cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2011, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex bitter brew, fruity/woody and slightly malty/spicy, easy to drink, very balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!

32 oz growler thanks to Schlais. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a big foamy head that fades to a ring and leaves some nice oily lacing. Awesome juicy aroma of pineapple, mango, peaches, spruce, and flowers. Taste is much of the same. Nice moderate, juicy sweetness and a very mild bitterness in the finish. Big fresh hop of pineapple, peaches, melon, and mango. I think Im getting a light hint of caramel too. Medium body. Very soft and creamy carbonation makes it pretty smooth. I think I would drink this very often if it was available locally.

Pour is hazy peach with thin white head. Nose is huge, extremely hop forward. Faint malt base with tons of citrus, peach, and grapefruit. Taste is insanely hoppy, malt base just holds balance with a touch of slightly doughy grain. The hops are the focus, huge citrus and grapefruit with notes of fuzzy peach skin and faint bitterness through the well carbonated finish on a light airy body. Great stuff, reminds of brighter heady.

This one poured a light orange color with a small white head. Aroma was of lots of tropical fruits, fresh crushed triple C hops, and grass, really nothing else. Flavor was probably the most balanced I might have ever had in a hop farward beer. Incredibly fresh cut hops, seems like heres more here than citra, not mouth hurting citra like Zombie dust though, very delicate without being malty, or sweet or bitter. Great stuff.
Golden orange color with light white head. Definitely mango with a hint of maybe pine. Nice malt balance. Really nice pale ale

22oz bottle pours a clear golden amber with a medium head. Aroma is as good as it gets, with amazingly fresh hops, floral, and grapefruit notes. Flavor is well balanced with Citra hops, mango, and light spruce. I bought every bottle I could get my hands on...oh wait this stuff is aweful, dont buy it! (more for me :-p

FInally got my hands on this one. A huge aroma of grapefruit and floral hops. Flavor just works. Not overly bitter. I was like a kid in a candy store going for this. Never had such high anticipation for an APA. Hard to believe this style can average over 4.0, but it is worth the hype. The only negative is that I realized when I got home that the growler didnt get filled to the top, and it wasnt pressure filled, so I had to consume right away. Bummer, j/k.

Bottle - gift from friend in Iowa. Super fresh bright citrus, mango/pineapple, and light biscuity malt aroma. Golden yellow with a moderate white head, heavy suspended flocculation. Fresh floral citrus, sweet juicy piney mango, and light crackery malt flavor. Light body, moderate carbonation. Extremely well done.

Wow! The hop aroma is so fresh! I smelled this many times before my first sip. Very fresh flavor with great hints of citrus & mango. Light bitterness - definitely not overpowering. Very glad we got 2 bottles today!!

Thank you Mike! Boy you werent kidding super fresh taste. Rich and fluffy head. Clouds of pleasure. Tons of sediment (if you stir it) A lot like Heady Topper only not as strong. Pour is slightly hazy gold with a medium white head. Flavor and aroma are exploding with wonderful citrus hop notes of mango, grapefruit, and passion fruit. Light malt backbone too. Faint pepper in the finish, really really good. Is it really a Pale ale though? Fabulous! Got any more Mike???
Overall the worst beer Ive ever had. Overpowering mango and lemon just absolutely destroy the flavor. Not a fan.
Growler from Casanova consumed in our downtown Minneapolis hotel. Quite a lot of beer for two people. Major sweet fruit pine aroma. Great! Tasted like s hoppy melon. Great APA.
So this is a mind blowing APA. Aromas are like sticking your nose in a melon. When you drink it, its like youre taking a bite of a melon. Some papaya too. So smooth and drinkable. Exceptional.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 I guarantee if these ratings were split between Florida cans and Iowa bombers/draft, this would be much higher.  If youve only had this in a can, you havent lived.  Every veteran Ratebeerian that rates this 4.5+
 had it from a bomber.  Night and day difference.

Update:  Another growler from Casanova, 2 hours after fill.  Aroma is off the charts - dank, melon, citrus, pine.  The taste on this stays so smooth and drinkable, with a mellow kick up front of this wonderful dank melon citrus combined with a dry grassy rusticness.  Its greatest strength is how it maintains a friendly drinkability while staying flavorful and interesting.  Just shy of perfect because I think my ideal beer would be an IPA version of this beer - almost identical but with slightly more vibrancy and intensity.  I cant imagine a better APA than this.  Drinkable to the extreme.  I could drink a growler of this in about 5 minutes.  
Another growler from Casanova, less than 4 hours after fill.  This is the 7% version, which TG had said is a one-time deviation from the 6% standard.  My new rating is a combination of both experiences.  Pours a hazy golden orange with giant white head that fades to a film leaving a curtain of great lacing down the glass. Aroma is a tropical fruit bomb, dank with mango, tangerine, and fresh-cut pine mixed in.  Taste follows suit with more tropical fruit, pine resin, and slight grassy bitterness.  It finishes clean and the bitterness ends mildly, leaving you ready for more and making this relatively sessionable, especially for 7%.  Palate is medium-light bodied and smooth.  Maybe Im just a sucker for Citra hops, but this might be my new favorite beer.  10+5+9+5+19=4.8  (3/4/14)
Growler from Casanova in Hudson, less than 24 hours after fill. Pours a clear golden orange with lasting white head and perfect lacing. Aroma is plenty of dank citrus with grass, pine, and pale malts. Taste is a bold continuation of the juicy citrus, with some bitter pineapple, pine and grass up front. Then, just enough richness from the malts to keep it from being overly resinous. Finishes juicy, then bitter, with lip-smacking pine resin. Crisp and ideal bitterness, with the aroma assisting all the way down the glass. Best APA Ive had, and most nuanced lower ABV beer Ive had. Outstanding. 10+5+9+4+18=4.6  (1/1/14)
One of the best pale ales you can find. Love the single hop focus, love citra hops. Fresh this is amazing, but even a month old it still rocks. Believe the hype, this is a great beer.
Yep this one rocks. Growler fill at Casanova in Hudson. Really fruity with big time citrus and tropical notes. This finish on this was amazing.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 On draft at bbq brick house in Madison. Nice lemony pine smell. Very cloudy yellow orange color. White head. Nice refreshing taste. Very citrusy. Slightly bitter, mostly on the back end. Solid easy drinking brew. RE-RATE: This time I bought a bomber that was freshly delivered today. Night and day. Awesome fresh hop smell. The taste us so much better too. When I had it on tap the first time at bbq brick house, it had a lemon pledge taste. Now its just nice citrusy greatness.

Poured into a snifter tasting glass from a growler.
Aroma- Very clean, fresh, vibrant hoppiness, citrus and floral smell.
Appearance - Poured golden orange with a good two finger head. Has good lacing at top of glass.
Taste- Full of complex citrus flavors... grapefruit, mango, pineapple, and papaya. 
Palate- Mouth feel was medium bodied with multiple flavors similar to the taste. It has a crisp, clean, and nice subtle sweetness to the finish. 
Overall - It is a very easy drinking beer that is well balanced. 
I am not a big IPA or APA drinker but this beer threw me off... meaning I found a APA I actually really like. This beer is so good that I finished a whole growler. I went back to the neighborhood pub and got two more growlers to share with friends and families the following weekend.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2016 Pours golden with small head and lace. Light hoppy aroma. flavors of straw and grapefruit hops, spicy pepper. Overall tasty with some complexity.
Feb. 20, 2016 - Similar details but less spicy pepper and a touch of persimmon, citrus zest.  Flavorful and refreshing.

Bottle from box aroma, pours a Budweiser color with a nice white head. Pretty puffy head. Aromas of citrus fruit, some juicy hops. Taste is a nice hop expression, a showcase of the hop without unneeded bitterness or harshness. Pretty flavorful, tropical, even a bit sweet. Nicely done.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Cloudy orange in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of raw citrusy hop cones, under ripe peach and tropical fruit pulp. More of the citrus and tropical fruit notes in the mouth, along with some herbal and chalky elements. Light bodied and not very bitter considering the insane level of hops. Not at all balanced in the traditional sense, but who really cares? This beer is awesome!

Growler from Casanovas in Hudson, Wisc. Pours a cloudy tangerine colour, not much for head, slight lacing. Nose- big blast of citra goodness. mangos, peach and other sweet tropical fruits. Taste- same tropical fruits come through from the nose along with pineapple and slight herbal quality. The pale malts add just the right firmness to the brew and dont get in the way of the hops. Super fresh and crazy quaffable. The bitterness of the hops finally come through on the finish just enough to keep the mouth watering for more. Great stuff

Bottle courtesy of Bytemesis.. Thank you! A damn fine PA. Concentrated aromas of tropical fruit, primarily mango, with some pineapple, sweet grapefruit and cat piss. Enjoyable mouthfeel, weight and carbonation on palate.. with a balanced bitterness.. and a hint of sweetness, that really makes the fruit pop. Well balanced. Tropical flavors follow through on the palate, with layers of ripe mango, juicy peach, and a some bitter citrus/grapefruit/resin... Overall, an impressive, balanced PA, with a ton of fruit and complex finish... with even more complexities as the beer warmed. Glad I got to try this.. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

In short: A very dry fruity-grassy-piney blonde pale ale.
How: Bottle 22oz, consumed fresh one week after receiving it from mcberko, thanks a lot Matt.
The look: Slightly cloudy orange-blonde body topped by a small white head.
In long: Highly aromatic hoppy nose with plenty of the usual tropical and exotic fruits that I get from Citra IPAs but this one has is a little less cat urine and a little more dry grass than more Citra IPAs Ive had. Body is lean and crispy with an active carbonation. Malt backbone is very very crisp and with a very low sweetness sensation. Feeling of crackery cereals, dry biscuits, dry hay and dry straws. Then fruity hops (tropical, exotic, citrusy) with sundried grass and pine-cones. The hops fruitiness has a fruit skin character. Short bitterness of medium intensity. Too dry to be considered really refreshing but the drinkability is through the roof. Something almost attic-rustic in the dryness character of the beer. I loved that beer. I like beers that are as dry as my humor and I hope my father dies on Mothers Day so I have great comedy material for that day.

On Tap from Brewpub. Aroma is very complex and instantly got my mouth watering. Appearance is slightly hazed yellow orange color with a thin white head. Taste is citrus and pine to start and a bit grassy on the finish. Good complex APA. Overall one of the best APAs Ive ever had. Liked it so much I bought a six pack of Bombers to go.

On tap at Dexters, and from bottle that same day. I believe the bottle was bottled less than 8 hours before I drank it, insane. Pours an unclear orange with a thick white head and awesome lacing through out, you could literally smell this 1. when my server was walking over with it at Dexters, and then 2. as soon as I cracked the cap of the bottle, amazing. Tons of citrus and grapefruit, so bright and lively, the flavor has a bright citrus front end with the tropical fruit in the finish, mouthfeel is nearly perfect. The fresh bottle jumped out at me more than the draft, but again thats probably because it was just bottled today. Right up there with the best.

Bottle at Bruces new pad, big thanks to Ryan via Leighton, 15/10/13.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white head.
Nose is pine forward, bitter orange, grapefruit, grass, good hop presence - lovely !
Taste comprises grapefruit, toasted malts, grassy, pine, light mango, orange pith, peachy goodness, light herbal element.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry grassy bitterness in the finish.
Cracking APA - up there in the top draw bracket!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bomber thanks to joshmcg000. Slightly hazy gold pour with a 2 finger, creamy off white head that has good retention and leaves a little lacing. Aroma is loaded with tropical fruit, sweet citrus and some pine, small amounts of perfumey floral notes. A little toast, biscuit and maybe a hint of caramel are there if you really stick your nose in it, but mostly just awesome, fruity hops. Flavor is similarly full of tropical fruit, lots of pineapple and passion fruit, some nice ripe melon, citrus and a hint of pine. Aside from hoppy, fruity notes there are light, but pleasant notes, of biscuit, caramel, toast, sweet apple, a little bread and just enough minerality to the finish to give it a pleasant crispness. Medium body, with a nice, creamy entry, moderate strength, blanketing carbonation and off dry, crisp finish. Fantastic, beer, perfectly drinkable, nearly flawless execution and loaded with hops. After reviewing Zombie Dust a few days ago and this little gem today, I may be a bit spoiled on Citra APAs. Thanks Josh!

Yellow pour with a white head. The aroma has some pine, orange and biscuit malt notes. The flavor has a lot of pine, toffee, oranges and medium bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Very nice pale ale.

One of my favorite pale ales. Tons of great tropical fruit and light pine notes from the citra. Finishes lightly bitter with awesome grapefruit notes. It really does taste nearly identical to zombie dust but with a little more rare.

15th October 2013Tasting at Bruces new pad. Thanks to Ryan! Big thanks! hazy gold beer with a good pale cream coloured head. Nice nose of floral lime. Palate is softish and light with a light minerally carbonation. Light grass and a little pine resin. Very light skunk. Trace of hop spice. Smooth finish with a minty aftertaste. Would never have known this was Citra hopped but this is one of those Pale Ales that showcase the non-fruit side of US hops. Very nice too!
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 Thanks chase, sooo juicy citrus and fruit aroma, soo smooth and well balanced! Awesome!

Pours a hazy orange with a medium creamy white head...nice heavy lacing. Aroma has nice fresh fruity(stonefruits) and leafy hop notes...just a bit of slightly sweet maktiness. Flavor has awesome grapefruit, mango and citrus rind. Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is dry and rindy/grapefruity and fresh. Some slight notes of almost sweet mango juice in this subtley enhance this nicely.

Thanks to my good buddy Drew for this one. Pours a slightly hazy golden with 1 finger head that lingers. This beer has a delicious aroma with a prominent with citrus and mango hops, toasted malt. Mildly sweet up front. Moderately bitter. This beer is incredibly well balanced. Long, pleasant hop finish. Medium body with moderate, not overpowering carbonation. This may rank up as one of my favorites.

Sampled on draft during the GTMW2013 festivities. Pours a nice orangish golden color with small white head. Aroma of big citra hops notes: citrus, tangerine, pine, touches of grass. Flavor is very delicious: nice grapefruit, tangerine and mango notes. Fair bitterness awash in the fruity hoppy deliciousness. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Finishes mildly bitter.

Bottle at Bruces, big thanks to Ryan. It pours hazy golden-orange with a medium white head. The nose is crisp, floral, grassy, pine, creamy orange, sherbet and faint menthol. The taste is crisp, grass, light herbal, crisp citrus, orange, grapefruit, white grape, floral and pine with a dry, crisp finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Brilliant balance. Eminently drinkable. Wow!
Bottle thanks to adnielsen. Aroma is piney citrusy hops, really clear and nice. Flavor is more subdued, but really balanced and hoppy. Really nice
Bottle, just like zombie dust, huge citra flavors with little hop bitterness. Really cool

22oz bottle, Steasy66 tasting at CBC Islington. Massive thanks to Ryan for this one!. It pours a peachy orange body with a soapy white head. Aroma is truly great with loads of super-fresh hops. Citrusy with orange and loads of pineapple notes. Some leafs and grass. Taste is hugely hoppy and fruity, but not excessively bitter. More citrusy notes and some pineapple and grass. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, top notch APA.

Bottle shared at Bruces in London - massive thanks to Ryan for bringing this over. Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy, white cap. Nose of delicate citrus, pale malts a bit of dank sweat. Light to medium sweet flavor with lots of dank, lightly dried citrus fruits, a bit of grapefruit. Light to medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Nice dryness to finish, moderate sweetness, great pale malt balance, light pine, orange, grapefruit. Outstanding. Absolutely world class.

Bottle care of Ryan (Steasy66). Hazy pale amber, foam white head. Nose is funky yeast, lots of citrous lemon, grapefruit. Taste is zinging citrous acidic then soft citrous, grapefruit, loads of papaya, lemon. Big papaya. Fresh and fruity.

Bottles cheers to Ryan. Wowee. Amazing stuff. Such a big and tangy citrus hop hit to it. Very floral and grassy too. Fair bit of grapefruit in the taste with an overdose of stone and citric hops. Very bitter right down the middle of the palate. Very, very good

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber, huge thanks to Ed. This is a showcase of the Citra hop. Grapefruit, pith, pine, big citrus character. The hop profile dominates and does not let the malts show. Very drinkable.
Bottle from my friendly brother boozedude. Bright orange, bubbly, remenents floating around. Soapy fruity bitter floral orange tastes. Love it. Unique

Taste is big bright citrusy hops, grassy, orange peel, floral, biscuit, weed, and grapefruit with a big bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Super hoppy but a beautifully clean malt profile. Really easy to drink.
Bomber at Stephens. pours neon orange with thin layer of head. Aroma is citrus hops, grapefruit, floral hoppy, orange citrus, very tasty. Finish is medium very soft, and gorgeous.

Bottle thanks to woodchopper. Pours a cloudy orange with a large frothy white head leaving good lacing. The aroma is strong citra hop and resin. Nice mouthfeel with citrus upfront and lingering light bitter finish. Really enjoyed this one.

Mostly citrusy type hop flavors and and some slight cattiness. Bitterness is moderately high but not astringent. Smooth. Some alcohol warmth. Very good IPA overall.
Bottle thanks to .... smells like hops just fresh wow the freshest apa hop flower I have had. Amazing.
Is it water minerals? Sulfur citric sweeter bright, light caramel. Tangy. Dry to off dry only slightly sweet. Low bitterness. White foam lightly cloudy and golden liquid.

22oz bomber. 
Aroma is full of tropical fruit including a ton of pineapple and light grapefruit. Hints of tropical fruit. The fruitiness is balanced nicely by a large amount of hop resin and dank pine and herbal notes. 
Pours a very cloudy pale golden hay with a moderately thick, slightly off white head that has good retention, but slowly fades to the edges. Moderate lacing and faint legs. Its not a very pretty beer.
Flavor is lightly sweet with some cracker notes and a hint of biscuit. The hop flavor is medium with some tropical fruit, pineapple, grapefruit and pine resin. Finish has a moderately low bitterness with some lingering cracker and bread notes as well as a touch of resiny hop character. Mouthfeel is medium to medium light bodied with medium low carbonation. Low hop astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall this is exactly what I want in a pale ale. Tons of hop aroma with a nice balanced flavor with good malt character. Medium bitterness. This is what I picture a modern pale ale to be. The hops and bitterness dont overwhelm the malt in the flavor either.

On tap at The Malt House

Flavor / Palate - Bright bitter hops sparkle on the tip of the tongue. An orange driven transition sweeps the flavor profile towards a dramatic and rosy finish. @RBWG-JAX Grand Tasting-bottle-thin white-hazy yellow. A-pine/citrus, yum. T-pine hops with some bite, 2nd lt malt.

Golden pour with frothy white head. Aroma is full of citrus, grapefruit a bit of light malt caramel. Flavor is sweet, reminiscent of mangos, bitter and resiny and finishes crisp. Great beer

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 Sampled at Midwest Belgian Beer Festival. Pours a golden color with white head. Very nice citrusy, grapefruit, and slightly resiny flavor. Very drinkable.
Draft. Gold pour, small white head. Little retention/some lace. Aroma of grass, orange peel, caramel. Lightly bitter, sweet. Soft, slick palate, light bitter finish.

Nice ipa here, pungeant flavor and aromas, decent bitterness in the flavor.

Draft at taproom. Pours yellow with an inch of white foam. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Big citrus on the nose. It almost punches you in the nose. Lovely grapefruit on the tongue but balanced so it could be sessionable. Finishes clean. Definitely a fantastic beer!

On tap at the brewpub. Comes a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and malt. Taste is citrus fruits, tropical fruits, pine, florals, and malt. Great balance, excellent APA.
Hazy orange with some white foam. Light citrus and toasted malts. Same with the flavor. So easy to drink.

Slightly hazy golden-orange body, medium sized white head, spotty lacing. Massive mango and grapefruit, some tropical and resinous notes. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, assertive bitterness in the finish. Nice.

Growler @ MPLS LOL tasting, courtesy of Bacterial. Pours a but hazy golden orange appearance with a thin off white head. Huge juicy mango, passion fruit, orange, a bit spicy hoppy aroma. Refreshing very pineapple, mango, vanilla, light cracker, lemon flavor. Yum.
Wonderful! Crisp clear yellow pour with a white head. Bright citrus nose. Bug hops and big citrus - excellent!

Pours a light orange with nice tight foam.  The citra hops really come through in the aroma, lots of grapefruit and tangerine.  Again the citra comes through strong in the taste, but leaves room to play with the light malt notes.  The finish leaves you with more citrus but is very clean.  This is a very session able beer.

Sampled at 4 Hands Lupulin Fest 2013 - Pours hazy yellow / orange with an off-white head.  The aroma has tangerine, mild sweetness, grapefruit, cotton candy and mustiness.  Medium / light body with a mild amount of carbonation.  The flavor begins with fruit, tangerine, mild toast and a bit of malty sweetness.  The finis has lots of grapefruit and tangerine.  Promising start to the fest here.

REVIEW

Style: India Pale Ale

ABV:5.8%

Purchased at: Reds Alehouse, North Liberty, IA on tap.

Pour: Orangish pour, nice medium-sized head, tons of lacing.

Aroma: All citra hop aroma. The smell is amazing.

Flavor: More citra hop, grapefruit, lemon, and orange mixed with a bit of pine. Wonderful!

Ratebeer.com rating: 98/100

Growler.  Medium orange pour, nice spotty lacing and carbonation with an aroma nice floral hops.  Flavor is lightly creamy oranges, hints of a little resiny pine and finished with a nice balance of malt & lemon hop bite.  Pretty nice, and worth the $10/growler.

pours a bold gold .. . mild foam .. . sap and an easy resin .. . light mouth .. . a good little ipa, a sneaky beer .. . . dinosaur beer

Citrusy and earthy.  Light body.  Cloudy.  Pine.  No head.  Very slight carbonation.  Pretty good.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Growler from Casanovas in Hudson, WI. Very sweet citrus floral hop notes, little pine and pineapple. Taste is nice pineapple sweet with a little pine hop bittering finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Ekroper for the growler took to RBWG, shared by Adam (Burg326).  Adam shared so many great beers and is also an awesome guy to drink with, like everyone there.  Fuck yeah, I love me some fresh citra.  Lots of tropical fruits and citrus, lightly resinous, and a very light sweetness.  Awesome Iowa Beer.

Thanks to Ekroper for the growler took to RBWG, however once I shared it with 3 people and I took a sip of it I became selfish and kept the rest for my personal enjoyment.  Poured a light orange color with huge citra aromas.  Flavors are the same amazing citrus flavors.  This was a great beer, that I hope they bottle soon.

Growler pour. Pours light amber orange with a soft white head that fades. Aroma is awesome citrus lemon bitter hops mango and pineapple. Taste is more of the above with bitter resinous hops citrus grapefruit lemon and pineapple with a perfect malt finish. Palate is medium clean and finishes dry. Awesome.

Served with a huge, fluffy, foamy, frothy, off-white head that lasts a while and plenty of lace. Color is a slightly hazy & dark amber with some bubble trails. Aroma is a startlingly fresh hop, reminiscent  of weed plus some sweet malt, citrus, resin. Flavors much like nose, bitterness stands out; just enough malt and carbonic tang to balance for a kick butt IPA. Body and carbbonation are faultless. Finiish is like flavor, long, and drrikable. V nicely done.
On tap at El Bait Shop. Super fruity. Pineapply. Not surprisingly for a TG brew, there is a  light simple hay malt profile that lets the hops shine.

Ok, its time to rate this.... been too busy sucking it down to take notes apparently.  
Pours a hazy light golden color with a big white head that leaves nice lacing on the glass.
 
The beer is ridiculously aromatic, its dank and piney and grapey and just very hop forward. Its a very appetizing aroma. 
 
The flavor is very hoppy and fruit forward with a little bit of yeastiness. The beer is basically dry and very hop focused with a moderate to high level of bitterness... 
 
I dont know, my rating makes it sound like a boring generic IPA, its really not... its pretty damned good. Sometimes I just suck about writing about beer.

Draft. Pours a nice slighlty hazed golden color with a white head that leaves sticky lace on the glass. Nice citrus note in the nose. Medium mouthfeel. Orange rind sweetness that then turns to a drawn out rind bitterness note. Some florals as well but most of the flavor is orange, grapefruit, and melon. Very nice IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2014 Tap. Pours hazy golden buttery amber with a small white head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is citrus, pine, tropical fruit and a bit of cat piss. Flavor is the same, lightly sweet, lightly bitter extending through the finish. Lightish  body, somewhat oily. Rerate after several bottles - this beer is pretty amazing actually. Who thought somebody could out do Zombie Dust, but TG has done it. Yum!
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Tap at the brewpub. Bright yellow pour, slightly hazy, spotty white head. Holy crap this is a citrus hop beast! Citrus everywhere, and its awesome. Excellent brew.

On tap at Dexters Pub. Pours an unclear orange with a fine white head; nice lacing that lasted and lasted. Aroma is so completely floral and citrus hops (hello citra!). Very lovely. Taste has sweet pine, bitter citrus and a lot of sweet caramel malt back. Very well balanced, much more so than the aroma would lead to believe. Finished medium long and heavier to the sweet side than the bitter, but with some of each. What more would you want from a balanced IPA - hop forward, great citra and solid caramel back. A nice one!

Enjoyed at GTMW 2012. Pours a cloudy golden color with a scant white head.  Smells of hops and autumn but the taste was not as hoppy as the smell. It was light and clean with an aftertaste of hops which quickly dissipated.

Draft on tap at Dexters Pub (Madison, WI). Pours a richer hazed orange amber hue, dulled colors, gentle glow beneath. A frothy white head atop dies to a thicker ring, laces ok overall. Aromas are rich Citra hops, grapefruit and melon, tropical fruit. Lemons, florals, grass, with a deep bouquet of grapefruit coming on strong. Bit of pale malt, bready, but this thing is hopped vibrantly. Initial is lighter end of the fold, bodywise. Good moderate bitter hop flavor shows lemons, florals, and grass. Soapy qualities, with dry bitter hops. Some bready mellow malts, fruity elements, and a firm bitterness. Citrus, touch tropical and soapy. Not as vibrant as the nose, the middle pushes some tropical fruit, melon. Fruity, the backend offers some firm to stronger lingering bitterness, soap, and florals. Dry bready malts, Fruity Citra elements. Soap, florals. Pretty solid, the nose really is spectacular, the beer is solid and quite drinkable. Fresh, big nose, perhaps a bit underwhelming when you compare the rest of the beer to that nose. Nice, bitterness takes bigger jabs at times up front. Flavors seem much more mellow than the nose would lead one to believe at times though. Highly recommended, regardless.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 Pre-GTMW at Dexters.  Great Citra showcase.  Slightly hazy orange.  Beautiful mango/pine/grapefruit aroma.  Flavor is a more of that characteristic Citra flavor of mango, pine, and grapefruit.  A little fruity malt.  Light, dry bitter finish.  Another great brew!  Re-rate:  bottle.  Spot on matches draft.  Enjoyable. --

Draft at Dexters,
Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma has big juicy clementines, grapefruit and pine. Flavors are really piney, clementines, juicy, and vibrant. Like zombie dust but higher ibus. Awesome pale!

8/10/12. On tap at the GTMW pre-party. Hazy orange pour with a nice khaki head. Nice fruity citra hop aroma with a certain weirdness in the end. Fruity citra hop flavor as well with definite pale malts in the finish, possibly pils?

Wow. What a great beer! As one whos had his share of IPAs, I find it hard to be bowled over by yet one more IPA--but this is not just one more IPA! The first thing that hits you is that glorious nose of grapefruit and herbs, and the flavor and the mouthful live up to the promise in that first impression. Proof that an IPA doesnt have to be over the top in ABV or IBU to be truly satisfying. I wish I lived in Iowa where I could have access to this regularly.
This beer has a good hop and citrus aroma. Cloudy gold appearance. Mild citrus hop flavor. Thick palate.  This is a solid ipa.

Had on tap at tasting, poured into 4 oz glass.

Appearance -cloudy yellow with little head.

Aroma--lots of grapefruit, grass and hop.

Taste-- very bitter to me, almost ammonia-like.  Tasted like the smell of cat urine--to me anyway.  I work at a vet clinic so this is commonplace smell for me.

Palate--dry, good carbonation, lightly sour on the back of tongue.

Overall, I didnt care for, many other patrons had pints after the tasting.  Just cant get over the ammonia I smell in the beer.

[On-tap at Toppling Goliath, and from growler] Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Huge tangerine and blood orange explodes from the glass. Outstanding, and exactly the hop profile I love to see in IPAs. The taste has lots of grapefruit, a subtle herbal quality which shows up after awhile, and just enough of a malt backbone to support it. Medium mouthfeel, and a long finish. Overall, I was impressed with this beer at the brewpub, especially since it is brewed in Iowa. When I had the growler of it while camping though, it put it over the top as one of my favorite IPAs. Very, very solid.
A nice hazy orange body to this citra hopped pale ale.  Nice lacing, and aroma.  Had on tap.  Not much head, or retention.  Definitely worth having again.

Tap at Reds in North Liberty. Hazy deep gold body with a bright white head. Bright floral nose with tons of citrus. There is also some wood. Taste is woody grapefruit and hay. Finishes clean with more citrus.

Hazy orange with a little white head. Huge citrus aroma, lots of grapefruit, some litter box. Flavor is very similar. Very hoppy, bitter finish. Minimal malt going on here. I wish this wasnt a rushed shitty celled phone rate, this beer deserves better.

On tap at Reds.  Big tropical fruit nose, mango, pineapple, also plenty of citrus going on, grapefruit comes through strong.  Pours hazy, light golden color, white head, good retention and lacing.  Fruit dominates the flavor profile as well - grapefruit and mango are most prominent, a touch of resin, nice light malt profile with a touch of background sweetness.  Bitterness is firm but hop flavor stays at the forefront - no astringent bitter aftertaste.  Light - medium body and carbonation.  Another great APA - keep em coming.

On tap at the GTMW. This Citra single hop pale has been on my mind since.. This beer smelled great and tasted even better! Nice color and easy to drink. On the lighter side, great aroma + mild bitterness. I went back for more a few times throughout the day!

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 On tap at GTMW - Second beer of the day pours hazy yellow with a light white head. Tons of citrus on the nose, with apricot and floral hops rounding it out. Super pungent. Nice and light taste, dominated by floral/herbal hops. Carbed up a bit too much, and a bit light-bodied, even for an APA. Liked this one a lot.

Update (7/2/13) - Drank two pints of this at Jaqs on Monroe last night. Beautiful looking beer, lots of citrus and garlic/onion dank hops on the nose. Pretty dry taste, with pale malt that lets the hops shine. Its dank and citrusy. Really pungent and awesome. Bumping up from my initial 3.7.

Draft at Reds. Poured a hazy yellow-light orange color. The head was white with good retention and lacing. Big citrus and tropical fruit aroma. Very nice nose. Light to medium bodied and delicately sweet with mild to moderate bitterness. Lots of hop flavors (mango, papaya, grapefruit, pine) supported by subdued malty caramel. Solid.
